name: DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC
description: The Windows Server 2012 Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DoD) information systems.

service.notes:
This template is created based on the recommended settings defined by Windows 2012 Domain Controller Security Technical Implementation Guide Version 2, Release 14 published on 26 Oct 2018

The Windows Server 2012 / 2012 R2 Domain Controller Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DoD) information systems. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via e-mail to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil.

Reference:
http://iase.disa.mil/stigs/checklist/
http://www.disa.mil/

extendedObjects.name: Get NTDS Drive
extendedObjects.script: nsh -c "nexec ??TARGET.NAME?? cmd.exe /c reg query 'HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\NTDS\Parameters' /v 'Database log files path' 2> /dev/null  | egrep -i 'Database log files path' | tr -s ' ' | sed 's/^ *Database *log *files *path *//I' | cut -d ' ' -f2 | cut -d ':' -f1"

extendedObjects.name: Get NTDS Path DSA Database file
extendedObjects.script: nsh -c "nexec ??TARGET.NAME?? cmd.exe /c reg query 'HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\NTDS\Parameters' /v 'DSA Database file'  2> /dev/null  | egrep -i 'DSA Database file' | tr -s ' ' | sed 's/^ *DSA Database *file *//I' | cut -d ' ' -f2 | tr -s '\' '/' | sed -e 's/://' -e 's/^/\//' "

extendedObjects.name: Get NTDS Path Database log files path
extendedObjects.script: nsh -c "nexec ??TARGET.NAME?? cmd.exe /c reg query 'HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\NTDS\Parameters' /v 'Database log files path'   2> /dev/null | egrep -i 'Database log files path' | tr -s ' ' | sed 's/^ *Database *log *files *path *//I' | cut -d ' ' -f2 | tr -s '\' '/' | sed -e 's/://' -e 's/^/\//' "

extendedObjects.name: List of unauthorized shares
extendedObjects.script: nsh -c "nexec ??TARGET.NAME?? cmd /c net share 2> /dev/null |egrep -vi '^(The *command)|(-+)'|egrep -v '^($| +)'| egrep -v `echo '^(??EXCLUDE_SYSTEM_SHARES??)' | sed -e 's%\\\\\$%\\\\\\\$%g'  | tr ',' '|'  `"

extendedObjects.name: V-1120
extendedObjects.description: Executes ftp commands on remote server using windows ftp.exe
extendedObjects.script: nsh -c "//BLTSERVER/C/Program Files/BMC Software/BladeLogic/storage/extended_objects/win_ftp_command_executor.nsh" -rscddir "??TARGET.RSCD_DIR??" -host "??TARGET.NAME??" -command "open localhost ; user anonymous password ; bye" -match "Login failed." -findingmessage "The host ??TARGET.NAME?? allows anonymous FTP connections."

extendedObjects.name: V-1121
extendedObjects.script: nsh -c "//BLTSERVER/C/Program Files/BMC Software/BladeLogic/storage/extended_objects/win_ftp_command_executor.nsh" -rscddir "??TARGET.RSCD_DIR??" -host "??TARGET.NAME??" -command "open  localhost ; user ??FTP_USER?? ??FTP_PASSWORD?? ; dir / ; bye" -match "PAGEFILE.SYS" -negatematch -findingmessage "The host: ??TARGET.NAME?? allows access to operating system files using FTP."

signature.name: Discovery Condition
signature.ruleExpression:
??TARGET.OS?? equals "Windows"  AND
(  ??TARGET.OS_RELEASE?? matches "6.2|6.2.*VC2.*"  OR
   ??TARGET.OS_RELEASE?? matches "6.3|6.3.*VC2.*"
)  AND
??TARGET.DOMAIN?? equals "DC"

rules.name: The system must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords.
rules.notes:
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The LAN Manager hash uses a weak encryption algorithm and there are several tools available that use this hash to retrieve account passwords.  This setting controls whether or not a LAN Manager hash of the password is stored in the SAM the next time the password is changed.  
IAControls: ECSC-1, IAIA-1, IAIA-2
ident: CCE-24150-5
ident: CCI-000196
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: The 6to4 IPv6 transition technology must be disabled.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: IPv6 transition technologies, which tunnel packets through other protocols, do not provide visibility.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24732-0
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\TCPIP\v6Transition\6to4_State" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\TCPIP\v6Transition\6to4_State"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_SZ"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\TCPIP\v6Transition\6to4_State"."String Value (Windows)" equals "Disabled"

ruleGroups.name: Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller

rules.name: The Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-002235
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller" user right may be able to retrieve the credentials of other accounts from Credential Manager.
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign []  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SETRUSTEDCREDMANACCESSPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

ruleGroups.name: Access this computer from the network

rules.name: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Access this computer from the network user right on domain controllers.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000213			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Access this computer from the network" right may access resources on the system and should be limited to those requiring it.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If an application requires this user right, this can be downgraded to not a finding if the following conditions are met:
Vendor documentation must support the requirement for having the user right.
The requirement must be documented with the IAO.
The application account must meet requirements for application account passwords, such as length (V-36661) and required changes frequency (V-36662).
IAControls: ECLP-1
Note: BUILTIN\Administrators,NT AUTHORITY\Authenticated Users groups will be added as remediation if none of these groups are present for this GPO.
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Access this computer from the network"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Access this computer from the network"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators", "NT AUTHORITY\Authenticated Users", "NT AUTHORITY\ENTERPRISE DOMAIN CONTROLLERS"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "BUILTIN\Administrators,NT AUTHORITY\Authenticated Users"
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SENETWORKLOGONRIGHT?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

ruleGroups.name: Accounts with administrative privileges Internet access

rules.name: Review Required: Policy must require that administrative accounts not be used with applications that access the Internet, such as web browsers, or with potential Internet sources, such as email.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366		 
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Using applications that access the Internet or have potential Internet sources using administrative privileges exposes a system to compromise.  If a flaw in an application is exploited while running as a privileged user, the entire system could be compromised.  Web browsers and email are common attack vectors for introducing malicious code and must not be run with an administrative account.
Since administrative accounts may generally change or work around technical restrictions for running a web browser or other applications, it is essential that policy requires administrative accounts to not access the Internet or use applications, such as email.
The policy should define specific exceptions for local service administration.  These exceptions may include HTTP(S)-based tools that are used for the administration of the local system, services, or attached devices.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Add workstations to domain user right.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Add workstations to domain" right may add computers to a domain.  This could result in unapproved or incorrectly configured systems being added to a domain.
IAControls: ECLP-1
ident: CCE-23271-0
ident: CCI-002235
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Add workstations to domain"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Add workstations to domain"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null

rules.name: Windows 2012/2012 R2 password for the built-in Administrator account must be changed at least annually or when a member of the administrative team leaves the organization.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The longer a password is in use, the greater the opportunity for someone to gain unauthorized knowledge of the password. The password for the built-in Administrator account must be changed at least annually or when any member of the administrative team leaves the organization.

Organizations that use an automated tool, such Microsoft's Local Administrator Password Solution (LAPS), on domain-joined systems can configure this to occur more frequently. LAPS will change the password every "30" days by default.
IAControls: ECPA-1

Note: Remediation is not Provided
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Extended Object Entry:administrator_password_requirement//SRR_Result/Status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" does not equal "Not a Finding"
then
   "Extended Object Entry:administrator_password_requirement//SRR_Result/Findings/*"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals null
end

rules.name: The Allow log on locally user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-000213
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Allow log on locally" user right can log on interactively to a system. 
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If an application requires this user right, this can be downgraded to not a finding if the following conditions are met:
Vendor documentation must support the requirement for having the user right.
The requirement must be documented with the IAO.
The application account must meet requirements for application account passwords, such as length (V-36661) and required changes frequency (V-36662).

Note: BUILTIN\Administrators groups will be added as remediation if none of these groups are present for this GPO
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Allow log on locally"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Allow log on locally"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "BUILTIN\Administrators"
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SEINTERACTIVELOGONRIGHT?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

ruleGroups.name: Always Install with Elevated Privileges Disabled

rules.name: The Windows Installer Always install with elevated privileges option must be disabled.
rules.notes:
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Standard user accounts must not be granted elevated privileges.  Enabling Windows Installer to elevate privileges when installing applications can allow malicious persons and applications to gain full control of a system.
IAControls: ECLP-1
ident: CCE-23919-4
ident: CCI-001812
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer\AlwaysInstallElevated" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer\AlwaysInstallElevated"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer\AlwaysInstallElevated"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: Named pipes that can be accessed anonymously must be configured with limited values on domain controllers.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-001090			  
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Named pipes that can be accessed anonymously provide the potential for gaining unauthorized system access.  Pipes are internal system communications processes.  They are identified internally by ID numbers that vary between systems.  To make access to these processes easier, these pipes are given names that do not vary between systems.  This setting controls which of these pipes anonymous users may access.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note: LSARPC, NETLOGON, SAMR groups will be added as remediation if none of these groups are present for this GPO
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ??NAMED_PIPES_ACCESSED_ANONYMOUSLY??  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "LSARPC, NETLOGON, SAMR"
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.NULLSESSIONPIPES?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

rules.name: Anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares must be restricted.
rules.notes:
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing anonymous access to named pipes or shares provides the potential for unauthorized system access.  This setting restricts access to those defined in "Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously" and "Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously",  both of which must be blank under other requirements.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24564-7
ident: CCI-001090
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Review Required: Directory data (outside the root DSE) of a non-public directory must be configured to prevent anonymous access.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: To the extent that anonymous access to directory data (outside the root DSE) is permitted, read access control of the data is effectively disabled.  If other means of controlling access (such as, network restrictions) are compromised, there may be nothing else to protect the confidentiality of sensitive directory data.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: The following network controls allow the finding severity to be downgraded to a CAT II since these measures lower the risk associated with anonymous access.
Network hardware ports at the site are subject to 802.1x authentication or MAC address restrictions. 
Premise firewall or host restrictions prevent access to ports 389, 636, 3268, and 3269 from client hosts not explicitly identified by domain (.mil) or IP address.
IAControls: ECAN-1, ECCD-1, ECCD-2
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

ruleGroups.name: Anonymous Access to Non-Public Root DSE Data

rules.name: Review Required: Anonymous access to the root DSE of a non-public directory must be disabled.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366			  
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing anonymous access to the root DSE data on a directory server provides potential attackers with a number of details about the configuration and data contents of a directory.  For example, the namingContexts attribute indicates the directory space contained in the directory; the supportedLDAPVersion attribute indicates which versions of the LDAP protocol the server supports; and the supportedSASLMechanisms attribute indicates the names of supported authentication mechanisms.  An attacker with this information may be able to select more precisely targeted attack tools or higher value targets.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: The following network controls allow the finding severity to be downgraded to not a finding since these measures lower the risk associated with anonymous access.
Network hardware ports at the site are subject to 802.1x authentication or MAC address restrictions. 
Premise firewall or host restrictions prevent access to ports 389, 636, 3268, and 3269 from client hosts not explicitly identified by domain (.mil) or IP address.
IAControls: ECAN-1, ECCD-1, ECCD-2
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Anonymous access to the registry must be restricted.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002235			  
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The registry is integral to the function, security, and stability of the Windows system.  Some processes may require anonymous access to the registry.  This must be limited to properly protect the system.
IAControls: ECCD-1, ECCD-2

Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression: "Registry Key:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurePipeServers\winreg"."Permission ACL (DACL) (Windows)" has only ACEs matching masks ["*\Administrators * []", "*\Backup Operators Allow [-Set Value, -Create Subkey, -Create Link, -Delete, -Write DAC, -Write Owner]", "*\LOCAL SERVICE Allow [-Set Value, -Create Subkey, -Create Link, -Delete, -Write DAC, -Write Owner]"]

rules.name: Anonymous SID_Name Translation must not be allowed.
rules.notes:
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing Anonymous SID_Name Translation can provide sensitive information for accessing a system.  Only authorized users must be able to perform such translations.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24597-7
ident: CCI-000366
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: The Application Compatibility Program Inventory must be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.  
This setting will prevent the Program Inventory from collecting data about a system and sending the information to Microsoft.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25331-0
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\AppCompat\DisableInventory" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\AppCompat\DisableInventory"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\AppCompat\DisableInventory"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Audit Policy Change failures.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000172
Ident:CCI-002234
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised.  Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Audit Policy Change records events related to changes in audit policy.
IAControls: ECAR-2, ECAR-3
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Policy Change\Audit Audit Policy Change"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Policy Change\Audit Audit Policy Change"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Policy Change\Audit Audit Policy Change"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [2, 3]  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Policy Change\Audit Audit Policy Change"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [2, 3]

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/Auditpol Remediation

rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000172
Ident:CCI-002234			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised.  Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts.

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Account Management\Audit User Account Management"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [2, 3]  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Account Management\Audit User Account Management"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [2, 3]

rules.name: Auditing the Access of Global System Objects must be turned off.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised.  Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
This setting prevents the system from setting up a default system access control list for certain system objects, which could create a very large number of security events, filling the security log in Windows and making it difficult to identify actual issues.

ident: CCI-001095

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Audit: Audit the access of global system objects"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

VulnDiscussion: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. rules.name: Autoplay must be turned off for non-volume devices.
rules.notes:
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing autoplay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system.  Autoplay begins reading from a drive as soon as media is inserted into the drive.  As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start.  This setting will disable autoplay for non-volume devices (such as Media Transfer Protocol (MTP) devices).
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24715-5
ident: CCI-001764
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer\NoAutoplayfornonVolume" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer\NoAutoplayfornonVolume"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer\NoAutoplayfornonVolume"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: The Back up files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-002235
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Back up files and directories" user right can circumvent file and directory permissions and could allow access to sensitive data.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If an application requires this user right, this can be downgraded to not a finding if the following conditions are met:
Vendor documentation must support the requirement for having the user right.
The requirement must be documented with the IAO.
The application account must meet requirements for application account passwords, such as length (V-36661) and required changes frequency (V-36662).

Note: Mark this rule as exception if any application uses this GPO as mentioned in above Severity Override Guidance
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Back up files and directories"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Back up files and directories"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SEBACKUPPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

rules.name: The number of allowed bad logon attempts must meet minimum requirements.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system.  The higher this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system.  The number of bad logon attempts must be reasonably small to minimize the possibility of a successful password attack, while allowing for honest errors made during a normal user logon.
IAControls: ECLO-1, ECLO-2
Ident: CCE-23909-5
Ident:CCI-000044
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout threshold"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout threshold"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout threshold"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" between [1 AND 3]  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout threshold"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" between [1 AND 3]

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: The reset period for the account lockout counter must be configured to 15 minutes or greater on Windows 2012
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that must pass after failed logon attempts before the counter is reset to 0. The smaller this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system.
IAControls: ECLO-1, ECLO-2
ident: CCI-000044,CCI-002238

Note: Both GPO's "Reset account lockout Counter after" and "Account lockout duration" have dependency and it should be resolved manually if non compliant
Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Reset account lockout counter after"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" greater than or equal to 15  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Reset account lockout counter after"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" greater than or equal to 15  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Reset account lockout counter after"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Reset account lockout counter after"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null

rules.name: Review Required: The system must not boot into multiple operating systems (dual-boot).
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000366		 
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing a system to boot into multiple operating systems (dual-booting) may allow security to be circumvented on a secure system.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Caching of logon credentials must be limited.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCE-24264-4
Ident:CCI-000366			  

Severity: CAT III
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The default Windows configuration caches the last logon credentials for users who log on interactively to a system.  This feature is provided for system availability reasons, such as the user's machine being disconnected from the network or domain controllers being unavailable.  Even though the credential cache is well protected, storing encrypted copies of users' passwords on workstations does not always have the same physical protection required for domain controllers.  If a workstation is attacked, an unauthorized individual may isolate the password to a domain user account using a password-cracking program and gain access to the domain.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note:If the system is not a member of a domain, this is NA.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Number of previous logons to cache (in case domain controller is not available)"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Number of previous logons to cache (in case domain controller is not available)"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Number of previous logons to cache (in case domain controller is not available)"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" between [0 AND 4]  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Number of previous logons to cache (in case domain controller is not available)"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" between [0 AND 4]

rules.notes:
ident: CCI-002235
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Create global objects" user right can create objects that are available to all sessions, which could affect processes in other users' sessions. 
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If an application requires this user right, this can be downgraded to not a finding if the following conditions are met:
Vendor documentation must support the requirement for having the user right.
The requirement must be documented with the IAO.
The application account must meet requirements for application account passwords, such as length (V-36661) and required changes frequency (V-36662).

Note: Mark this rule as exception if any application uses this GPO as mentioned in above Severity Override Guidance.

rules.name: The Create symbolic links user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002235
Severity: CAT II 
Weight: 10.0 

VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high level capabilities.

Accounts with the "Create symbolic links" right can create pointers to other objects which could potentially expose the system to attack.
 
Documentable: false 
Responsibility: System Administrator 
IAControls: ECLP-1 

Fix text: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create symbolic links" to only include the following accounts or groups: 
Administrators
Systems that have the Hyper-V role will also have "Virtual Machines" given this user right. If this needs to be added manually, enter it as "NT Virtual Machine\Virtual Machines".
Fix id: F-29572r1_fix 

Note: Compliance to be cheched manually  for the Systems that have the Hyper-V role. Remediation is not provided for this part of the rule.
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Create symbolic links"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Create symbolic links"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then

rules.name: The Ctrl+Alt+Del security attention sequence for logons must be enabled.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Disabling the Ctrl+Alt+Del security attention sequence can compromise system security.  Because only Windows responds to the Ctrl+Alt+Del security sequence, a user can be assured that any passwords entered following that sequence are sent only to Windows.  If the sequence requirement is eliminated, malicious programs can request and receive a user's Windows password.  Disabling this sequence also suppresses a custom logon banner.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25803-8
ident: CCI-000366
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Do not require CTRL+ALT+DEL"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Do not require CTRL+ALT+DEL"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Do not require CTRL+ALT+DEL"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Do not require CTRL+ALT+DEL"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: Active Directory data files must have proper access control permissions.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002235			  
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Improper access permissions for directory data related files could allow unauthorized users to read, modify, or delete directory data or audit trails.
IAControls: ECAN-1, ECCD-1, ECCD-2

Note: Remediation is not provided.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\NTDS\Parameters\Database log files path" exists
then
   ??DIR_PATH_NTDS?? assign "Extended Object Entry:Get NTDS Path Database log files path//**".Name  AND
   "File:??DIR_PATH_NTDS??/**"."Inherit Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" equals true  AND
   "File:??DIR_PATH_NTDS??/**"."Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\ADMINISTRATORS Allow []"  AND
   "File:??DIR_PATH_NTDS??/**"."Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\SYSTEM Allow []"
end  AND
if
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\NTDS\Parameters\DSA Database file" exists
then
   ??PATH_NTDS?? assign "Extended Object Entry:Get NTDS Path DSA Database file//**".Name  AND
   "File:??PATH_NTDS??"."Inherit Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" equals true  AND
   "File:??PATH_NTDS??"."Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\ADMINISTRATORS Allow []"  AND
   "File:??PATH_NTDS??"."Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\SYSTEM Allow []"
end

rules.name: The default Autorun behavior must be configured to prevent Autorun commands.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-001764
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing Autorun commands to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. Configuring this setting prevents Autorun commands from executing.

Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\NoAutorun" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\NoAutorun"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\NoAutorun"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Microsoft Active Protection Service membership must be disabled.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.  
This setting disables Microsoft Active Protection Service membership and reporting.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25247-8
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Spynet\SpyNetReporting" exists
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Spynet\SpyNetReporting"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Spynet\SpyNetReporting"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0
end

The Guests group must be assigned this right to prevent unauthenticated access.

??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Guests"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_GPO_LIST??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_GPO_LIST??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
   end  AND
   if
      ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
   then
      foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
         if
            NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
         then
            ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
         end
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " BUILTIN\Guests"  AND
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null  AND
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"

   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SEDENYNETWORKLOGONRIGHT?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"

ruleGroups.name: Device Install - Drivers System Restore Point

rules.name: A system restore point must be created when a new device driver is installed.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: A system restore point allows a rollback if an issue is  encountered when a new device driver is installed.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23669-5
ident: CCI-000366
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DeviceInstall\Settings\DisableSystemRestore" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DeviceInstall\Settings\DisableSystemRestore"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DeviceInstall\Settings\DisableSystemRestore"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

ruleGroups.name: Device Install - Generic Driver Error Report

rules.name: An Error Report must not be sent when a generic device driver is installed.
rules.notes:

This setting prevents an error report from being sent when a generic device driver is installed.

ident: CCE-23275-1
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DeviceInstall\Settings\DisableSendGenericDriverNotFoundToWER" exists  AND

rules.name: Review Required: Domain Controller PKI certificates must be issued by the DoD PKI or an approved External Certificate Authority (ECA).
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000185
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: A PKI implementation depends on the practices established by the Certificate Authority (CA) to ensure the implementation is secure. Without proper practices, the certificates issued by a CA have limited value in authentication functions.  The use of multiple CAs from separate PKI implementations results in interoperability issues.  If servers and clients do not have a common set of root CA certificates, they are not able to authenticate each other.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If the certificates in use are issued by a CA authorized by the Components CIO, this is a CAT II finding.
IAControls: IAKM-1, IAKM-2, IATS-1, IATS-2
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Review Required: PKI certificates associated with user accounts must be issued by the DoD PKI or an approved External Certificate Authority (ECA).
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000185			  
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: A PKI implementation depends on the practices established by the Certificate Authority (CA) to ensure the implementation is secure.  Without proper practices, the certificates issued by a CA have limited value in authentication functions.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If the certificates in use are issued by a CA authorized by the Components CIO, this is a CAT II finding.
IAControls: IAKM-1, IAKM-2, IATS-1, IATS-2
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Data files owned by users must be on a different logical partition from the directory server data files.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-001082			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: When directory service data files, especially for directories used for identification, authentication, or authorization, reside on the same logical partition as user-owned files, the directory service data may be more vulnerable to unauthorized access or other availability compromises.  Directory service and user-owned data files sharing a partition may be configured with less restrictive permissions in order to allow access to the user data. 
The directory service may be vulnerable to a denial of service attack when user-owned files on a common partition are expanded to an extent preventing the directory service from acquiring more space for directory or audit data.
IAControls: DCSP-1

Note:Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\NTDS\Parameters\Database log files path" exists  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\NTDS\Parameters\Database log files path"."String Value (Windows)" does not equal null
then
   ??PATH_NTDS?? assign "Extended Object Entry:Get NTDS Drive//**".Name  AND
   foreach "Extended Object Entry:List of unauthorized shares//**"
      if
         @"Value1 as String (All OS)"@ does not start with (case sensitive) "name"
      then
         "Extended Object Entry:List of unauthorized shares//**"."Value1 as String (All OS)" does not start with (case sensitive) "??PATH_NTDS??"
      end
   end
end

rules.name: Review Required: The directory server supporting (directly or indirectly) system access or resource authorization must run on a machine dedicated to that function.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-001082			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Executing application servers on the same host machine with a directory server may substantially weaken the security of the directory server.  Web or database server applications usually require the addition of many programs and accounts increasing the attack surface of the computer. 
Some applications require the addition of privileged accounts providing potential sources of compromise.  Some applications (such as MS Exchange) may require the use of network ports or services conflicting with the directory server.  In this case, non-standard ports might be selected and this could interfere with intrusion detection or prevention services.
IAControls: DCSP-1

Note:Compliance check is manual.Remediation is not provided.
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Automatic logons must be disabled. - 1
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
ident: CCI-000366

VulnDiscussion: Allowing a system to automatically log on when the machine is booted could give access to any unauthorized individual who restarts the computer. Automatic logon with administrator privileges would give full access to an unauthorized individual.

Note : Part 1 of this rule will check HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\DefaultPassword registry key exist, Manually need to be deleted if rule is non-compliant. Part 2  of this rule will check GPO. Remediation is not provided for Part 1
rules.ruleExpression: "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\defaultpassword" does not exist

rules.name: Automatic logons must be disabled. - 2
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-000366
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing a system to automatically log on when the machine is booted could give access to any unauthorized individual who restarts the computer. Automatic logon with administrator privileges would give full access to an unauthorized individual.

Note : This part will check GPO policy.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: (AutoAdminLogon) Enable Automatic Logon (not recommended)"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: (AutoAdminLogon) Enable Automatic Logon (not recommended)"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: (AutoAdminLogon) Enable Automatic Logon (not recommended)"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: (AutoAdminLogon) Enable Automatic Logon (not recommended)"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: Autoplay must be disabled for all drives.
rules.notes:
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing autoplay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system.  Autoplay begins reading from a drive as soon media is inserted into the drive.  As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start.  By default, autoplay is disabled on removable drives, such as the floppy disk drive (but not the CD-ROM drive) and on network drives.  Enabling this policy disables autoplay on all drives.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23878-2
ident: CCI-001764
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\policies\Explorer\NoDriveTypeAutorun" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\policies\Explorer\NoDriveTypeAutorun"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\policies\Explorer\NoDriveTypeAutorun"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 255

ruleGroups.name: Enable accounts to be trusted for delegation

rules.name: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation user right on domain controllers.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002235			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation" user right allows the "Trusted for Delegation" setting to be changed.  This could potentially allow unauthorized users to impersonate other users.
IAControls: ECLP-1
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SEENABLEDELEGATIONPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

ruleGroups.name: Force shutdown from a remote system

rules.name: The Force shutdown from a remote system user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-002235
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Force shutdown from a remote system" user right can remotely shut down a system, which could result in a DoS.
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Force shutdown from a remote system"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Force shutdown from a remote system"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SEREMOTESHUTDOWNPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

ruleGroups.name: Forcibly Disconnect when Logon Hours Expire

rules.name: Users must be forcibly disconnected when their logon hours expire.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Users must not be permitted to remain logged on to the network after they have exceeded their permitted logon hours.  In many cases, this indicates that a user forgot to log off before leaving for the day.  However, it may also indicate that a user is attempting unauthorized access at a time when the system may be less closely monitored.  Forcibly disconnecting users when logon hours expire protects critical and sensitive network data from exposure to unauthorized personnel with physical access to the computer.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24148-9
ident: CCI-001133
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: The Generate security audits user right must only be assigned to Local Service and Network Service.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-002235
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Generate security audits" user right specifies users and processes that can generate Security Log audit records, which must only be the system service accounts defined.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If an application requires this user right, this can be downgraded to not a finding if the following conditions are met:
Vendor documentation must support the requirement for having the user right.
The requirement must be documented with the IAO.
The application account must meet requirements for application account passwords, such as length (V-36661) and required changes frequency (V-36662).

Note: Mark this rule as exception if any application uses this GPO as mentioned in above Severity Override Guidance.
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Generate security audits"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Generate security audits"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["NT AUTHORITY\LOCAL SERVICE", "NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SEAUDITPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

rules.name: The default permissions of global system objects must be increased.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Windows systems maintain a global list of shared system resources such as DOS device names, mutexes, and semaphores.  Each type of object is created with a default DACL that specifies who can access the objects with what permissions.  If this policy is enabled, the default DACL is stronger, allowing nonadministrative users to read shared objects, but not modify shared objects that they did not create.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24633-0
ident: CCI-000366
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects (e.g. Symbolic Links)"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects (e.g. Symbolic Links)"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects (e.g. Symbolic Links)"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects (e.g. Symbolic Links)"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

ruleGroups.name: Group Policy - Do Not Turn off Background Refresh

rules.name: Group Policies must be refreshed in the background if the user is logged on.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: If this setting is enabled, then Group Policy settings are not refreshed while a user is currently logged on.  This could lead to instances when a user does not have the latest changes to a policy applied and is therefore operating in an insecure context.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23622-4
ident: CCI-000366
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\DisableBkGndGroupPolicy" exists
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\DisableBkGndGroupPolicy"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\DisableBkGndGroupPolicy"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0
end

rules.name: Group Policy objects must be reprocessed even if they have not changed.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Enabling this setting and then selecting the "Process even if the Group Policy objects have not changed" option ensures that the policies will be reprocessed even if none have been changed.  This way, any unauthorized changes are forced to match the domain-based group policy settings again.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24992-0
ident: CCI-000366
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}\NoGPOListChanges" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}\NoGPOListChanges"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}\NoGPOListChanges"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: Review Required: Active Directory Group Policy objects must have proper access control permissions.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002235			  
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: When directory service database objects do not have appropriate access control permissions, it may be possible for malicious users to create, read, update, or delete the objects and degrade or destroy the integrity of the data.  When the directory service is used for identification, authentication, or authorization functions, a compromise of the database objects could lead to a compromise of all systems relying on the directory service.
For Active Directory (AD), the Group Policy objects require special attention.  In a distributed administration model (i.e., help desk), Group Policy objects are more likely to have access permissions changed from the secure defaults.  If inappropriate access permissions are defined for Group Policy Objects, this could allow an intruder to change the security policy applied to all domain client computers (workstations and servers).
IAControls: ECAN-1, ECCD-1, ECCD-2, ECLP-1
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: The HBSS McAfee Agent must be installed.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366			 

Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The McAfee Agent is the client side distributed component of McAfee ePolicy Orchestrator (McAfee ePO) which provides a secure communication channel between the ePO server and managed point products.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note: Remediation is not Provided.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Windows Service:McAfee Framework Service" exists
then
   ??VAR_MCAFEE_FRAMEWORK_SERVICE?? assign "McAfee Framework Service"
elseif
   "Windows Service:McAfee Agent Service" exists
then
   ??VAR_MCAFEE_FRAMEWORK_SERVICE?? assign "McAfee Agent Service"
end  AND
??VAR_MCAFEE_FRAMEWORK_SERVICE?? does not equal null  AND
if
   ??VAR_MCAFEE_FRAMEWORK_SERVICE?? does not equal null
then
   "Windows Service:??VAR_MCAFEE_FRAMEWORK_SERVICE??"."State (Windows)" equals "RUNNING"
end

ruleGroups.name: Idle Time Before Suspending a Session.

rules.name: The amount of idle time required before suspending a session must be properly set.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Open sessions can increase the avenues of attack on a system.  This setting is used to control when a computer disconnects an inactive SMB session.  If client activity resumes, the session is automatically reestablished.  This protects critical and sensitive network data from exposure to unauthorized personnel with physical access to the computer.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23897-2
ident: CCI-001133
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" less than or equal to 15  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" less than or equal to 15

rules.name: The Impersonate a client after authentication user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-002235
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Impersonate a client after authentication" user right allows a program to impersonate another user or account to run on their behalf.  An attacker could potentially use this to elevate privileges.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If an application requires this user right, this can be downgraded to not a finding if the following conditions are met:
Vendor documentation must support the requirement for having the user right.
The requirement must be documented with the IAO.
The application account must meet requirements for application account passwords, such as length (V-36661) and required changes frequency (V-36662).

Note: Mark this rule as exception if any application uses this GPO as mentioned in above Severity Override Guidance.
BUILTIN\Administrators,NT AUTHORITY\LOCAL SERVICE,NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE,NT AUTHORITY\SERVICE groups will be added as remediation if none of these groups are present for this GPO.
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Impersonate a client after authentication"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Impersonate a client after authentication"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators", "NT AUTHORITY\LOCAL SERVICE", "NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE", "NT AUTHORITY\SERVICE"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " BUILTIN\Administrators,NT AUTHORITY\LOCAL SERVICE,NT AUTHORITY\NETWORK SERVICE,NT AUTHORITY\SERVICE"
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SEIMPERSONATEPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

rules.name: The directory service must be configured to terminate LDAP-based network connections to the directory server after five (5) minutes of inactivity.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-001133			 
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The failure to terminate inactive network connections increases the risk of a successful attack on the directory server.  The longer an established session is in progress, the more time an attacker has to hijack the session, implement a means to passively intercept data, or compromise any protections on client access.  For example, if an attacker gains control of a client computer, an existing (already authenticated) session with the directory server could allow access to the directory.  The lack of confidentiality protection in LDAP-based sessions increases exposure to this vulnerability.
IAControls: ECTM-1, ECTM-2
Note : Remediation is not available
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   NOT ("Extended Object Entry:V-14831//SRR_Result/Status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals "Not a Finding")
then
   "Extended Object Entry:V-14831//SRR_Result/Findings/**"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals null
end

rules.name: Review Required: Servers must have a host-based Intrusion Detection System.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002664			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: A properly configured host-based Intrusion Detection System provides another level of defense against unauthorized access to critical servers.  With proper configuration and logging enabled, such a system can stop and/or alert for many attempts to gain unauthorized access to resources.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: This finding can be downgraded to a CAT III, if there is an active JIDS or firewall protecting the network.
