Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: The computer clock synchronization tolerance must be limited to 5 minutes or less.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: This setting determines the maximum time difference (in minutes) that Kerberos will tolerate between the time on a client's clock and the time on a server's clock while still considering the two clocks synchronous.  In order to prevent replay attacks, Kerberos uses timestamps as part of its protocol definition.  For timestamps to work properly, the clocks of the client and the server need to be in sync as much as possible.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25365-8
ident: CCI-001941
Note : To remediate this setting to 'Default Domain Policy' set REMEDIATE_SETTING_FOR_GPO Property to 'Default Domain Policy'.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Extended Object Entry:Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization//SRR_Result/status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" does not equal "Not a Finding"
then
   "Extended Object Entry:Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization//SRR_Result/findings/*"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals null
end

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: The Kerberos user ticket lifetime must be limited to 10 hours or less.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: In Kerberos, there are 2 types of tickets: Ticket Granting Tickets (TGTs) and Service Tickets.  Kerberos tickets have a limited lifetime so the time an attacker has to implement an attack is limited.  This policy controls how long TGTs can be renewed.  With Kerberos, the user's initial authentication to the domain controller results in a TGT which is then used to request Service Tickets to resources.  Upon startup, each computer gets a TGT before requesting a service ticket to the domain controller and any other computers it needs to access.  For services that startup under a specified user account, users must always get a TGT first, then get Service Tickets to all computers and services accessed.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24230-5
ident: CCI-000366
Note : To remediate this setting to 'Default Domain Policy' set REMEDIATE_SETTING_FOR_GPO Property to 'Default Domain Policy'.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Extended Object Entry:Maximum lifetime for user ticket//SRR_Result/status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" does not equal "Not a Finding"
then
   "Extended Object Entry:Maximum lifetime for user ticket//SRR_Result/findings/*"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals null
end

rules.name: Kerberos encryption types must be configured to prevent the use of DES and RC4 encryption suites.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-000803
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Certain encryption types are no longer considered secure. The DES and RC4 encryption suites must not be used for Kerberos encryption.

Note: Removing the previously allowed RC4_HMAC_MD5 encryption suite may have operational impacts and must be thoroughly tested for the environment before changing. This includes but is not limited to parent\child trusts where RC4 is still enabled; selecting "The other domain supports Kerberos AES Encryption" may be required on the domain trusts to allow client communication across the trust relationship.

If you do select any encryption type, you will lower the effectiveness of encryption for Kerberos authentication but you will improve interoperability with computers running older versions of Windows.

Note: Remediation is not provided.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [2147483640]  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [2147483640]

rules.name: The Kerberos service ticket maximum lifetime must be limited to 600 minutes or less.
rules.notes:

Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: This setting determines the maximum amount of time (in minutes) that a granted session ticket can be used to access a particular service.  Session tickets are used only to authenticate new connections with servers.  Ongoing operations are not interrupted if the session ticket used to authenticate the connection expires during the connection.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23419-5
ident: CCI-000366
Note : To remediate this setting to 'Default Domain Policy' set REMEDIATE_SETTING_FOR_GPO Property to 'Default Domain Policy'.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Extended Object Entry:Maximum lifetime for service ticket//SRR_Result/status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" does not equal "Not a Finding"
then
   "Extended Object Entry:Maximum lifetime for service ticket//SRR_Result/findings/*"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals null
end

rules.name: Domain controllers must require LDAP access signing.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Unsigned network traffic is susceptible to man in the middle attacks where an intruder captures packets between the server and the client and modifies them before forwarding them to the client.  In the case of an LDAP server, this means that an attacker could cause a client to make decisions based on false records from the LDAP directory.  You can lower the risk of an attacker pulling this off in a corporate network by implementing strong physical security measures to protect the network infrastructure.  Furthermore, implementing Internet Protocol security (IPSec) authentication header mode (AH), which performs mutual authentication and packet integrity for Internet Protocol (IP) traffic, can make all types of man in the middle attacks extremely difficult.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23587-9
ident: CCI-002418
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Domain controller: LDAP server signing requirements"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Domain controller: LDAP server signing requirements"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Domain controller: LDAP server signing requirements"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 2  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Domain controller: LDAP server signing requirements"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 2

NTLM, which is less secure, is retained in later Windows versions  for compatibility with clients and servers that are running earlier versions of Windows or applications that still use it.  It is also used to authenticate logons to stand-alone computers that are running later versions.

rules.name: The Lock pages in memory user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-002235
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Lock pages in memory" user right allows physical memory to be assigned to processes, which could cause performance issues or a DoS.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If an application requires this user right, this can be downgraded to not a finding if the following conditions are met:
Vendor documentation must support the requirement for having the user right.
The requirement must be documented with the IAO.
The application account must meet requirements for application account passwords, such as length (V-36661) and required changes frequency (V-36662).

Note: Mark this rule as exception if any application uses this GPO as mentioned in above Severity Override Guidance.
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Lock pages in memory"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Lock pages in memory"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign []  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SELOCKMEMORYPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: Windows 2012 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that an account will remain locked after the specified number of failed logon attempts.
IAControls: ECLO-1, ECLO-2
Ident: CCI-002238
Note: Both GPO's "Reset account lockout Counter after" and "Account lockout duration" have dependency and it should be resolved manually if non compliant
Remediation is not available
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout duration"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout duration"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
(  "Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout duration"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0  OR
   "Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout duration"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" greater than or equal to 15
)  AND
(  "Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout duration"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0  OR
   "Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout duration"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" greater than or equal to 15
)

This setting prevents the MSDT from communicating with and sending collected data to Microsoft, the default support provider.

rules.name: The Application event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly and require frequent clearing by administrative personnel.
IAControls: ECRR-1
ident: CCI-001849
Note: If the system is configured to write events directly to an audit server mark this rule as exception. Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Application\MaxSize" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Application\MaxSize"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Application\MaxSize"."Integer Value (Windows)" greater than or equal to 32768

rules.name: The maximum age for machine account passwords must be set to requirements.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Computer account passwords are changed automatically on a regular basis.  This setting controls the maximum password age that a machine account may have.  This setting must be set to no more than 30 days, ensuring the machine changes its password monthly.
IAControls: IAIA-1, IAIA-2
ident: CCE-23596-0
ident: CCI-000366
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Domain member: Maximum machine account password age"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Domain member: Maximum machine account password age"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Domain member: Maximum machine account password age"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" between [1 AND 30]  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Domain member: Maximum machine account password age"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" between [1 AND 30]

rules.name: The maximum password age must meet requirements.
rules.notes:

Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The longer a password is in use, the greater the opportunity for someone to gain unauthorized knowledge of the passwords.   Scheduled changing of passwords hinders the ability of unauthorized system users to crack passwords and gain access to a system.
IAControls: IAIA-1, IAIA-2
Ident: CCE-24535-7
Ident: CCI-000199
rules.ruleExpression:

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Maximum password age"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Maximum password age"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" between [1 AND 60]  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Maximum password age"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" between [1 AND 60]

rules.name: Windows Media Digital Rights Management (DRM) must be prevented from accessing the Internet.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.  
This check verifies that Windows Media DRM will be prevented from accessing the Internet.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24380-8
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WMDRM\DisableOnline" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WMDRM\DisableOnline"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WMDRM\DisableOnline"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Windows Media Player must be configured to prevent automatic checking for updates.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Uncontrolled system updates can introduce issues to a system.  The automatic check for updates performed by Windows Media Player must be disabled to ensure a constant platform and to prevent the introduction of unknown\untested software on the system.
IAControls: DCSL-1
ident: CCE-24250-3
ident: CCI-001812
Note: If Windows Media Player is not installed,mark this rule as exception.Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsMediaPlayer\DisableAutoupdate" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsMediaPlayer\DisableAutoupdate"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsMediaPlayer\DisableAutoupdate"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

ruleGroups.name: Media Player - First Use Dialog Boxes

rules.name: Users must not be presented with Privacy and Installation options on first use of Windows Media Player.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.  
This setting prevents users from being presented with Privacy and Installation options on first use of Windows Media Player, which could enable some communication with the vendor.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25014-2
ident: CCI-000366
Note: If Windows Media Player is not installed,mark this rule as exception.Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsMediaPlayer\GroupPrivacyAcceptance" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsMediaPlayer\GroupPrivacyAcceptance"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsMediaPlayer\GroupPrivacyAcceptance"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Review Required: Media Player must be configured to prevent automatic Codec downloads.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The Windows Media Player uses software components, referred to as Codecs, to play back media files.  By default, when an unknown file type is opened with the Media Player, it will search the Internet for the appropriate Codec and automatically download it.  To ensure platform consistency and to protect against new vulnerabilities associated with media types, all Codecs must be installed by the System Administrator.
IAControls: DCSL-1
ident: CCE-23890-7
ident: CCI-001812
Note:Compliance check is manual since we cannot check HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry . Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

ruleGroups.name: Members of the Backup Operators Group

rules.name: Review Required: Members of the Backup Operators group must be documented.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Backup Operators are able to read and write to any file in the system, regardless of the rights assigned to it.  Backup and restore rights permit users to circumvent the file access restrictions present on NTFS disk drives for backup and restore purposes.  Visibility of members of the Backup Operators group must be maintained.
IAControls: ECLP-1
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: The Microsoft FTP service must not be installed unless required.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
ident: CCI-000382
VulnDiscussion: Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Windows Service:Microsoft FTP Service" exists
then
   "Windows Service:Microsoft FTP Service"."Start Type (Windows)" equals "DISABLED"  AND
   "Windows Service:Microsoft FTP Service"."State (Windows)" equals "STOPPED"
end

rules.name: The built-in Windows password complexity policy must be enabled.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000192
Ident:CCI-000193
Ident:CCI-000194
Ident:CCI-001619
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The use of complex passwords increases their strength against attack. The built-in Windows password complexity policy requires passwords to contain at least 3 of the 4 types of characters (numbers, upper- and lower-case letters, and special characters), as well as preventing the inclusion of user names or parts of.

Note: If an external password filter is in use that enforces all 4 character types and requires this setting be set to "Disabled", this would not be considered a finding. If this setting does not affect the use of an external password filter, it must be enabled for fallback purposes
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Passwords must meet complexity requirements"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Passwords must meet complexity requirements"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Passwords must meet complexity requirements"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Passwords must meet complexity requirements"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Minimum password age"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" greater than or equal to 1

rules.name: Local volumes must use a format that supports NTFS attributes
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000213		 
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The ability to set access permissions and auditing is critical to maintaining the security and proper access controls of a system.  To support this, volumes must be formatted using the NTFS file system.
IAControls: ECCD-1, ECCD-2
Note:Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Extended Object Entry:File System information//**" exists  AND
foreach "Extended Object Entry:File System information//**"
   @"Value1 as String (All OS)"@ contains "NTFS"  OR
   @"Value1 as String (All OS)"@ contains "ReFS"
end

ident: CCI-000366

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Allow LocalSystem NULL session fallback"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Allow LocalSystem NULL session fallback"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.notes:

Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Configuring the system to ignore name release requests, except from WINS servers, prevents a denial of service (DoS) attack.  The DoS consists of sending a NetBIOS name release request to the server for each entry in the server's cache, causing a response delay in the normal operation of the servers WINS resolution capability.

ident: CCE-23715-6
ident: CCI-002385

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow the computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow the computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow the computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.notes:

Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The Mapper I/O network protocol (LLTDIO) driver allows the discovery of the connected network and allows various options to be enabled.  Disabling this helps protect the system from potentially discovering and connecting to unauthorized devices.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25156-1
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:

rules.name: Optional Subsystems must not be permitted to operate on the system.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The POSIX subsystem is an Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers (IEEE) standard that defines a set of operating system services.  The POSIX Subsystem is required if the server supports applications that use that subsystem.  The subsystem introduces a security risk relating to processes that can potentially persist across logins.  That is, if a user starts a process and then logs out, there is a potential that the next user who logs in to the system could access the previous users process.  This is dangerous because the process started by the first user may retain that users system privileges, and anything the second user does with that process will be performed with the privileges of the first user.
ThirdPartyTools: HK
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24878-1
ident: CCI-000381
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\System settings: Optional subsystems"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" equals null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\System settings: Optional subsystems"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" equals null

rules.name: Active directory user accounts, including administrators, must be configured to require the use of a Common Access Card (CAC), PIV-compliant hardware token, or Alternate Logon Token (ALT) for user authentication.

Ident:CCI-000766
Ident:CCI-000767
Ident:CCI-000768
Ident:CCI-001948

Weight:	10.0

VulnDiscussion: Smart cards such as the Common Access Card (CAC) support a two-factor authentication technique. This provides a higher level of trust in the asserted identity than use of the username and password for authentication.
rules.ruleExpression:

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Require smart card"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Require smart card" exists  AND

rules.name: PKU2U authentication using online identities must be prevented.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: PKU2U is a peer-to-peer authentication protocol.   This setting prevents online identities from authenticating to domain-joined systems.  Authentication will be centrally managed with Windows user accounts.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25299-9
ident: CCI-000366
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: Windows 2012/2012 R2 passwords must be configured to expire.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000199			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Passwords that do not expire or are reused increase the exposure of a password with greater probability of being discovered or cracked. 
Note : Remediation is not available
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   NOT ("Extended Object Entry:V-6840//SRR_Result/Status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals "Not a Finding")
then
   "Extended Object Entry:V-6840//SRR_Result/Findings/**"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals null
end

rules.name: Users must be warned in advance of their passwords expiring.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Creating strong passwords that can be remembered by users requires some thought.  By giving the user advance warning, the user has time to construct a sufficiently strong password.  This setting configures the system to display a warning to users telling them how many days are left before their password expires.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23704-0
ident: CCI-000366
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Prompt user to change password before expiration"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Prompt user to change password before expiration"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Prompt user to change password before expiration"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" greater than or equal to 14  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Prompt user to change password before expiration"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" greater than or equal to 14

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: Windows 2012/2012 R2 accounts must be configured to require passwords
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000764			  
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The lack of password protection enables anyone to gain access to the information system, which opens a backdoor opportunity for intruders to compromise the system as well as other resources.  Accounts on a system must require passwords.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Extended Object Entry:User Password Requirement//SRR_Result/status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" does not equal "Not a finding"
then
   "Extended Object Entry:User Password Requirement//SRR_Result/findings/*"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals null
end

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/Net User Options-Remediation

rules.name: The password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
ident: CCI-000200

VulnDiscussion: A system is more vulnerable to unauthorized access when system users recycle the same password several times without being required to change to a unique password on a regularly scheduled basis. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes. The default value is 24 for Windows domain systems. DoD has decided this is the appropriate value for all Windows systems.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Enforce password history"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Enforce password history"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Enforce password history"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 24  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Enforce password history"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 24

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

ruleGroups.name: Peer Networking Identity Manager Service Disabled

rules.name: The Peer Networking Identity Manager service must be disabled if installed.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24910-2
ident: CCI-000381
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Windows Service:Peer Networking Identity Manager" exists
then
   "Windows Service:Peer Networking Identity Manager"."Start Type (Windows)" equals "DISABLED"  AND
   "Windows Service:Peer Networking Identity Manager"."State (Windows)" equals "STOPPED"
end

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/Services-Remediation

rules.name: The Perform volume maintenance tasks user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-002235
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Perform volume maintenance tasks" user right can manage volume and disk configurations.  They could potentially delete volumes, resulting in data loss or a DoS.
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Perform volume maintenance tasks"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Perform volume maintenance tasks"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SEMANAGEVOLUMEPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Active Directory (AD) is dependent on several Windows services.  If one or more of these services is not configured for automatic startup, AD functions may be partially or completely unavailable until the services are manually started.  This could result in a failure to replicate data or to support client authentication and authorization requests.
IAControls: ECTM-1, ECTM-2


Note: Windows Time (not required if another time synchronization tool is implemented to start automatically). According add or remove this service from SERVICES_CHECK_STARTUP_AUTOMATIC_V-8327 variable.

   "Extended Object Entry:Services_Check_Startup_Automatic_V-8327//SRR_Result/status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" does not equal "Not a finding"
then
   "Extended Object Entry:Services_Check_Startup_Automatic_V-8327//SRR_Result/findings/*"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals null
end

rules.name: Network Bridges must be prohibited in Windows.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: A Network Bridge can connect two or more network segments, allowing unauthorized access or exposure of sensitive data.  This setting prevents a Network Bridge from being installed and configured.  
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25587-7
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Network Connections\NC_AllowNetBridge_NLA" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Network Connections\NC_AllowNetBridge_NLA"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Network Connections\NC_AllowNetBridge_NLA"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: File Transfer Protocol (FTP) servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366			

Severity: medium

Weight:	10.0


VulnDiscussion: The FTP service allows remote users to access shared files and directories. Allowing anonymous FTP connections makes user auditing difficult.
Using accounts that have administrator privileges to log on to FTP risks that the userid and password will be captured on the network and give administrator access to an unauthorized user.

Note : Remediation is not available
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Windows Service:Microsoft FTP Service" exists  AND
   "Windows Service:Microsoft FTP Service"."State (Windows)" equals "RUNNING"
then
   if
      NOT ("Extended Object Entry:V-1120//SRR_Result/Status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals "Not a Finding")
   then
      "Extended Object Entry:V-1120//SRR_Result/Finding*"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals null
   end
end

rules.name: Attachments must be prevented from being downloaded from RSS feeds.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Attachments from RSS feeds may not be secure.  This setting will prevent attachments from being downloaded from RSS feeds.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25340-1
ident: CCI-000366
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Feeds\DisableEnclosureDownload" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Feeds\DisableEnclosureDownload"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Feeds\DisableEnclosureDownload"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: The system must be configured to prevent unsolicited remote assistance offers.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Remote assistance allows another user to view or take control of the local session of a user.  Unsolicited remote assistance is help that is offered by the remote user.  This may allow unauthorized parties access to the resources on the computer.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23282-7
ident: CCI-001090
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fAllowUnsolicited" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fAllowUnsolicited"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fAllowUnsolicited"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: Remote Assistance log files must be generated.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  This setting will turn on session logging for Remote Assistance connections.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24603-3
ident: CCI-000366
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\LoggingEnabled" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\LoggingEnabled"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\LoggingEnabled"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Solicited Remote Assistance must not be allowed.
rules.notes:
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0

ident: CCE-25590-1
ident: CCI-001090

"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fAllowToGetHelp"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: Unauthorized remotely accessible registry paths must not be configured.
rules.notes:
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The registry is integral to the function, security, and stability of the Windows system.  Some processes may require remote access to the registry.  This setting controls which registry paths are accessible from a remote computer.  These registry paths must be limited, as they could give unauthorized individuals access to the registry.
IAControls: ECCD-1, ECCD-2
ident: CCE-23899-8
ident: CCI-001090
Note: System\CurrentControlSet\Control\ProductOptions,System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Server Applications,Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion groups will be added as remediation if none of these groups are present for this GPO
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ??REMOTELY_ACCESSIBLE_REGISTRY_PATHS??  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "System\CurrentControlSet\Control\ProductOptions,System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Server Applications,Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion"
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.REMOTELYACCESSIBLEREGISTRYPATHS?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

rules.name: The built-in administrator account must be renamed.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The built-in administrator account is a well-known account subject to attack.  Renaming this account to an unidentified name improves the protection of this account and the system.
IAControls: IAAC-1
ident: CCE-23836-0
ident: CCI-000366

Note: Remediation is not provided.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Accounts: Rename administrator account"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Accounts: Rename administrator account"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Accounts: Rename administrator account"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal "Administrator"  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Accounts: Rename administrator account"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal "Administrator"

rules.name: The built-in guest account must be renamed.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The built-in guest account is a well-known user account on all Windows systems and, as initially installed, does not require a password.  This can allow access to system resources by unauthorized users.  Renaming this account to an unidentified name improves the protection of this account and the system.
IAControls: IAAC-1
ident: CCE-23675-2
ident: CCI-000366

Note: Remediation is not provided.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Accounts: Rename guest account"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal "Guest"  AND

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Accounts: Rename guest account"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Accounts: Rename guest account"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null

rules.name: The Restore files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-002235
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Restore files and directories" user right can circumvent file and directory permissions and could allow access to sensitive data.  It could also be used to overwrite more current data.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If an application requires this user right, this can be downgraded to not a finding if the following conditions are met:
Vendor documentation must support the requirement for having the user right.
The requirement must be documented with the IAO.
The application account must meet requirements for application account passwords, such as length (V-36661) and required changes frequency (V-36662).

Note: Remediation is not provided.
Note: Mark this rule as exception if any application uses this GPO as mentioned in above Severity Override Guidance.
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Restore files and directories"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Restore files and directories"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SERESTOREPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

Weight:	10.0

rules.name: The Windows SMB client must be configured to always perform SMB packet signing.
rules.notes:

ident: CCE-24969-8
ident: CCI-002418

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always)"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: The system must be configured to use Safe DLL Search Mode.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The default search behavior, when an application calls a function in a Dynamic Link Library (DLL), is to search the current directory, followed by the directories contained in the system's path environment variable.  An unauthorized DLL, inserted into an application's working directory, could allow malicious code to be run on the system.  Setting this policy value forces the system to search the %Systemroot% for the DLL before searching the current directory or the rest of the path.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23462-5
ident: CCI-000366
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: Enable Safe DLL search mode (recommended)"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: Enable Safe DLL search mode (recommended)"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: Enable Safe DLL search mode (recommended)"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: Enable Safe DLL search mode (recommended)"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.notes:

rules.name: Outgoing secure channel traffic must be signed when possible.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Requests sent on the secure channel are authenticated, and sensitive information (such as passwords) is encrypted, but the channel is not integrity checked.  If this policy is enabled, outgoing secure channel traffic will be signed.
ident: CCI-002418
ident: CCI-002421
rules.ruleExpression:

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible)"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible)"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: The Simple TCP/IP Services service must be disabled if installed.
rules.notes:

if

then

end

rules.name: Software certificate installation files must be removed from Windows 2012/2012 R2.

 set SCAN_WHOLE_SYSTEM property to true for whole system scan, this will take more than 2 hours and depends on files under SCAN_DRIVE property. 

Note:  Remediation is not available
rules.ruleExpression:
??SCAN_WHOLE_SYSTEM?? equals true  AND

   end
end

rules.name: The system must be configured to limit how often keep-alive packets are sent.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: This setting controls how often TCP sends a keep-alive packet in attempting to verify that an idle connection is still intact.  A higher value could allow an attacker to cause a denial of service with numerous connections.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24310-5
ident: CCI-002385
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: How often keep-alive packets are sent in milliseconds"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: How often keep-alive packets are sent in milliseconds"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" less than or equal to 300000  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: How often keep-alive packets are sent in milliseconds"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" less than or equal to 300000

rules.name: The system must limit how many times unacknowledged TCP data is retransmitted.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: In a SYN flood attack, the attacker sends a continuous stream of SYN packets to a server, and the server leaves the half-open connections open until it is overwhelmed and is no longer able to respond to legitimate requests.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25455-7
ident: CCI-002385
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is default)"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is default)"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is default)"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" less than or equal to 3  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is default)"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" less than or equal to 3

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: The Remote Desktop Session Host must require secure RPC communications.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing unsecure RPC communication exposes the system to man-in-the-middle attacks and data disclosure attacks.  A man-in-the-middle attack occurs when an intruder captures packets between a client and server and modifies them before allowing the packets to be exchanged.  Usually the attacker will modify the information in the packets in an attempt to cause either the client or server to reveal sensitive information. 
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24788-2
ident: CCI-001453
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fEncryptRPCTraffic" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fEncryptRPCTraffic"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fEncryptRPCTraffic"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Remote Desktop Services must limit users to one remote session.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing multiple Remote Desktop Services sessions could consume resources.  There is also potential to make a secondary connection to a system with compromised credentials.
IAControls: ECLO-1, ECLO-2
ident: CCE-23328-8
isent: CCI-000054
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fSingleSessionPerUser" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fSingleSessionPerUser"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fSingleSessionPerUser"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Users must be prevented from mapping local COM ports and redirecting data from the Remote Desktop Session Host to local COM ports.  (Remote Desktop Services Role).
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Preventing the redirection of Remote Desktop session data to a client computer's COM ports helps reduce possible exposure of sensitive data.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24625-6
ident: CCI-002314
Note: Remediation is not available.Compliance will check only if Remote desktop role is installed.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Extended Object Entry:List all installed services and roles//SRR_Result/Status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals "Open"
then
   foreach "Extended Object Entry:List all installed services and roles//SRR_Result/Findings/*"
      if
         @"Value1 as String (All OS)"@ contains "Remote-Desktop-Services"
      then
         "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fDisableCcm" exists  AND
         "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fDisableCcm"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
         "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fDisableCcm"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1
      end
   end
else
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:List all installed services and roles//SRR_Result/Status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals "Not Reviewed"
   then
      ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false
   end
end

rules.name: Remote Desktop Services must delete temporary folders when a session is terminated.

Weight:	10.0

ident: CCI-000366

"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\DeleteTempDirsOnExit"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Saving passwords in the Remote Desktop Client could allow an unauthorized user to establish a remote desktop session to another system.  The system must be configured to prevent users from saving passwords in the Remote Desktop Client.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23787-5
ident: CCI-002038
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\DisablePasswordSaving" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\DisablePasswordSaving"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\DisablePasswordSaving"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Remote Desktop Services must be configured with the client connection encryption set to the required level.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Remote connections must be encrypted to prevent interception of data or sensitive information. Selecting "High Level" will ensure encryption of Remote Desktop Services sessions in both directions.
IAControls: ECCT-1, ECCT-2
ident: CCE-24932-6
ident: CCI-000068
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\MinEncryptionLevel" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\MinEncryptionLevel"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\MinEncryptionLevel"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 3

rules.name: The system must be configured to ensure smart card devices can be redirected to the Remote Desktop session.  (Remote Desktop Services Role).
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Enabling the redirection of smart card devices allows their use within Remote Desktop sessions.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24260-2
ident: CCI-002314
Note: Remediation is not available.Compliance will check only if Remote desktop role is installed.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Extended Object Entry:List all installed services and roles//SRR_Result/Status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals "Open"
then
   foreach "Extended Object Entry:List all installed services and roles//SRR_Result/Findings/*"
      if
         @"Value1 as String (All OS)"@ contains "Remote-Desktop-Services"
      then
         "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fEnableSmartCard" exists  AND
         "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fEnableSmartCard"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
         "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fEnableSmartCard"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1
      end
   end
else
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:List all installed services and roles//SRR_Result/Status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals "Not Reviewed"
   then
      ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false
   end
end

ruleGroups.name: Take ownership of files or other objects

rules.name: The Take ownership of files or other objects user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-002235
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Take ownership of files or other objects" user right can take ownership of objects and make changes.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If an application requires this user right, this can be downgraded to not a finding if the following conditions are met:
Vendor documentation must support the requirement for having the user right.
The requirement must be documented with the IAO.
The application account must meet requirements for application account passwords, such as length (V-36661) and required changes frequency (V-36662).

Note: Mark this rule as exception if any application uses this GPO as mentioned in above Severity Override Guidance.
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Take ownership of files or other objects"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Take ownership of files or other objects"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SETAKEOWNERSHIPPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: The Telnet service must be disabled if installed.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24474-9
ident: CCI-000382
rules.ruleExpression:
if

then

end

rules.name: The Teredo IPv6 transition technology must be disabled.
rules.notes:

Weight:	10.0

IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25571-1
ident: CCI-000382
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\TCPIP\v6Transition\Teredo_State" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\TCPIP\v6Transition\Teredo_State"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_SZ"  AND

rules.name: Time synchronization must be enabled on the domain controller.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-001891			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: When a directory service using multi-master replication (such as AD) executes on computers that do not have synchronized time, directory data may be corrupted or updated invalidly.
The lack of synchronized time could lead to audit log data that is misleading, inconclusive, or unusable. In cases of intrusion this may invalidate the audit data as a source of forensic evidence in an incident investigation.
In AD, the lack of synchronized time could prevent clients from logging on or accessing server resources as a result of Kerberos requirements related to time variance.
IAControls: ECTM-1, ECTM-2


Note: If these Windows checks indicate a finding because the NtpClient is not enabled, determine if an alternate time synchronization tool is installed and enabled.If the Windows Time Service is not enabled and no alternate tool is enabled, this is a finding.

Note: Remediation is not Provided.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Windows Service:Windows Time" exists  AND
   "Windows Service:Windows Time"."State (Windows)" equals "RUNNING"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\W32Time\TimeProviders\NtpClient\Enabled" exists  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\W32Time\TimeProviders\NtpClient\Enabled"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\W32Time\Parameters\Type" exists  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\W32Time\Parameters\Type"."String Value (Windows)" is one of ["NT5DS", "NTP", "AllSync"]
else
   ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false
end

rules.name: The time synchronization tool must be configured to enable logging of time source switching.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: When a time synchronization tool executes, it may switch between time sources according to network or server contention.  If switches between time sources are not logged, it may be difficult or impossible to detect malicious activity or availability problems.
IAControls: ECTM-1, ECTM-2

Note: If another time synchronization tool is used, review the available configuration options and logs. If the tool has time source logging capability and it is not enabled, this is a finding. Also, Remediation is not provided.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Windows Service:Windows Time" exists  AND
   "Windows Service:Windows Time"."State (Windows)" equals "RUNNING"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\W32Time\Config\EventLogFlags" exists  AND
   (  "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\W32Time\Config\EventLogFlags"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 2  OR
      "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\W32Time\Config\EventLogFlags"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 3
   )
else
   ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false
end

ident: CCE-24134-9

"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\User Account Control: Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\User Account Control: Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

ruleGroups.name: Unencrypted Password is Sent to SMB Server.

rules.name: Unencrypted passwords must not be sent to third-party SMB Servers.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Ident:CCI-000197			  
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Some non-Microsoft SMB servers only support unencrypted (plain text) password authentication.  Sending plain text passwords across the network, when authenticating to an SMB server, reduces the overall security of the environment.  Check with the vendor of the SMB server to see if there is a way to support encrypted password authentication.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Microsoft network client: Send unencrypted password to third-party SMB servers"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND

rules.name: Necessary services must be documented to maintain a baseline to determine if additional, unnecessary services have been added to a system. - 1
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000381
Severity: medium 
Weight: 10.0 

VulnDiscussion:Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some services may be run under the local System account, which generally has more permissions than required by the service. Compromising a service could allow an intruder to obtain system permissions and open the system to a variety of attacks.

Fix text: Document the services required for the system to operate.  Remove or disable any services that are not required. 

Note 1 : Rule is divided into 4 parts.
Note 2: Services those are depends upon other service might not get remediate. Compliance not provided for services like Windows Firewall,  Also compliance is not checked for services that have Manual(Trigger Start),Automatic (Delayed Start) and Automatic (Trigger Start).
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Extended Object Entry:Services_Check_Startup_Automatic_Delayed//SRR_Result/status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" does not equal "Not a finding"
then
   "Extended Object Entry:Services_Check_Startup_Automatic_Delayed//SRR_Result/findings/*"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals null
end

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/MultiServices-Remediation

rules.name: Necessary services must be documented to maintain a baseline to determine if additional, unnecessary services have been added to a system. - 4
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000381
Severity: medium 
Weight: 10.0 

VulnDiscussion:Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some services may be run under the local System account, which generally has more permissions than required by the service. Compromising a service could allow an intruder to obtain system permissions and open the system to a variety of attacks.

Fix text: Document the services required for the system to operate.  Remove or disable any services that are not required. 

Note 1 : Rule is divided into 4 parts.
Note 2: Services those are depends upon other service might not get remediate. Compliance not provided for services like Windows Firewall,  Also compliance is not checked for services that have Manual(Trigger Start),Automatic (Delayed Start) and Automatic (Trigger Start).
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Extended Object Entry:Services_Check_Startup_Manual//SRR_Result/status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" does not equal "Not a finding"
then
   "Extended Object Entry:Services_Check_Startup_Manual//SRR_Result/findings/*"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals null
end

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/MultiServices-Remediation

??TARGET.OS_VERSION?? equals "2012"

ruleGroups.name: User Right - Act as part of OS

rules.name: The Act as part of the operating system user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-002235
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Act as part of the operating system" user right can assume the identity of any user and gain access to resources that user is authorized to access.  Any accounts with this right can take complete control of a system.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If an application requires this user right, this can be downgraded to a CAT III if the following conditions are met:
Vendor documentation must support the requirement for having the user right.
The requirement must be documented with the IAO.
The application account must meet requirements for application account passwords, such as length (V-36661) and required changes frequency (V-36662).
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Act as part of the operating system"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Act as part of the operating system"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign []  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SETCBPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: The Debug programs user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
rules.notes:
ident: CCI-002235
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Debug programs" user right can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel, providing complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components.  This right is given to Administrators in the default configuration.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If an application requires this user right, this can be downgraded to a CAT III if the following conditions are met:
Vendor documentation must support the requirement for having the user right.
The requirement must be documented with the IAO.
The application account must meet requirements for application account passwords, such as length (V-36661) and required changes frequency (V-36662).
rules.ruleExpression:
??VAR_GPO_LIST?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Debug programs"."Effective setting as List of String values (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_GPO_STRING?? assign "Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\User Rights Assignment\Debug programs"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)"  AND
??VAR_CURRENT_GPO?? assign ["BUILTIN\Administrators"]  AND
if
   ??VAR_GPO_STRING?? does not equal null
then
   foreach ??VAR_GPO_LIST??
      ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??  AND
      if
         NOT (??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??)
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end  AND
      if
         ??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR?? is one of ??VAR_CURRENT_GPO??
      then
         ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign "??VAR_REM_VALUE??,??LOOP_ATTR_FOR_COMPLIANCE_STR??"
      end
   end
else
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "  AND
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:SYSTEM_TYPE//DC" exists
   then
      NOT (??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null)  AND
      if
         ??VAR_GPO_LIST?? equals null
      then
         ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? assign "1"
      end
   end
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? equals null
then
   ??VAR_REM_VALUE?? assign " "
end  AND
if
   ??VAR_COMP_FLAG?? equals "1"
then
   ??TARGET.Remediation Properties.SEDEBUGPRIVILEGE?? persist "??VAR_REM_VALUE??"
end
