rules.name: Review Required: The operating system must employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs.
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-001774			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
Vulnerability Discussion: Utilizing a whitelist provides a configuration management method for allowing the execution of only authorized software. Using only authorized software decreases risk by limiting the number of potential vulnerabilities.

The organization must identify authorized software programs and only permit execution of authorized software. The process used to identify software programs that are authorized to execute on organizational information systems is commonly referred to as whitelisting.

Note:  Compliance to be checked manually. Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Review Required: Protection methods such as TLS, encrypted VPNs, or IPSEC must be implemented if the data owner has a strict requirement for ensuring data integrity and confidentiality is maintained at every step of the data transfer and handling process.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002420
Ident:CCI-002422
Severity: medium 
Weight: 10.0 

VulnDiscussion:Information can be either unintentionally or maliciously disclosed or modified during preparation for transmission, for example, during aggregation, at protocol transformation points, and during packing/unpacking. These unauthorized disclosures or modifications compromise the confidentiality or integrity of the information.
Ensuring the confidentiality of transmitted information requires the operating system to take measures in preparing information for transmission. This can be accomplished via access control and encryption.
Use of this requirement will be limited to situations where the data owner has a strict requirement for ensuring data integrity and confidentiality is maintained at every step of the data transfer and handling process. When transmitting data, operating systems need to support transmission protection mechanisms such as TLS, encrypted VPNs, or IPSEC.

Fix text: Configure protection methods such as TLS, encrypted VPNs, or IPSEC when the data owner has a strict requirement for ensuring data integrity and confidentiality is maintained at every step of the data transfer and handling process to maintain the confidentiality and integrity.
Note : Compliance to be checked manually. Remediation not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Review Required:: Systems requiring data at rest protections must employ cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of the information at rest.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-001199
Ident:CCI-002475
Ident:CCI-002476
Severity: medium 
Weight: 10.0 

VulnDiscussion:This requirement addresses protection of user-generated data, as well as operating system-specific configuration data. Organizations may choose to employ different mechanisms to achieve confidentiality and integrity protections, as appropriate, in accordance with the security category and/or classification of the information.
Selection of a cryptographic mechanism is based on the need to protect the integrity of organizational information. The strength of the mechanism is commensurate with the security category and/or classification of the information. Organizations have the flexibility to either encrypt all information on storage devices (i.e., full disk encryption) or encrypt specific data structures (e.g., files, records, or fields).

Fix text: Configure systems that require additional protections due to factors such as inadequate physical protection or sensitivity of the data to employ encryption to protect the confidentiality and integrity of all information at rest. 
Note : Compliance to be checked manually. Remediation not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Review Required: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on Windows 2012 R2.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000381			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0

VulnDiscussion: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.

Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000381
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.

Note: The system must be restarted for the change to take effect.This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters\SMB1" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters\SMB1"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters\SMB1"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/ADM Remediation

rules.name: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client - 1
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000381
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.

Note : Rule is divided into 2 parts. This part checks for Start value in the given registry path.
Note: Required admx/adml files as mentioned in check-list should be copy to policydefinition location. Remediation will be only effect if these files are present.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10\Start" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10\Start"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 4  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10\Start"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/ADM Remediation

rules.name: The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client - 2
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000381
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.

Note : Rule is divided into 2 parts. This part checks for DependOnService value in the given registry path.
Note: Required admx/adml files as mentioned in check-list should be copy to policydefinition location. Remediation will be only effect if these files are present.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanWorkstation\DependOnService" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanWorkstation\DependOnService"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_MULTI_SZ"  AND
(  "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanWorkstation\DependOnService"."String Value (Windows)" contains (case sensitive) "Bowser"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanWorkstation\DependOnService"."String Value (Windows)" contains (case sensitive) "MRxSmb20"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanWorkstation\DependOnService"."String Value (Windows)" contains (case sensitive) "NSI"
)

rules.name: Windows PowerShell must be updated to a version that supports script block logging on Windows 2012/2012 R2
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
Vulnerability Discussion: Later versions of Windows PowerShell provide additional security and advanced logging features that can provide greater detail when malware has been run on a system. PowerShell 5.x includes the advanced logging features. PowerShell 4.0 with the addition of patch KB3000850 on Windows 2012 R2 or KB3119938 on Windows 2012 adds advanced logging features.

PowerShell is updated with the installation of the corresponding version of the Windows Management Framework (WMF).

Updating to a later PowerShell version may have compatibility issues with some applications. The following links should be reviewed and updates tested before applying to a production environment.

WMF 4.0:
Review the System Requirements under the download link - https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40855

WMF 5.0:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/wmf/5.0/productincompat

WMF 5.1:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/wmf/5.1/productincompat
Note: :Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   ??TARGET.OS_VERSION?? equals "2012 R2"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\PowerShell\3\PowerShellEngine\PowerShellVersion"."String Value (Windows)" matches "5.*"
end  AND
if
   ??TARGET.OS_VERSION?? equals "2012"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\PowerShell\3\PowerShellEngine\PowerShellVersion"."String Value (Windows)" equals "4.0"  OR
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\PowerShell\3\PowerShellEngine\PowerShellVersion"."String Value (Windows)" matches "5.*"
end

rules.name: PowerShell script block logging must be enabled on Windows 2012/2012 R2 - 1
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000135
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Enabling PowerShell script block logging will record detailed information from the processing of PowerShell commands and scripts. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.
PowerShell 5.x supports script block logging. PowerShell 4.0 with the addition of patch KB3000850 on Windows 2012 R2 or KB3119938 on Windows 2012 adds support for script block logging.

Note: This Rule is divided into 2 parts. This part checks EnableScriptBlockLogging parameter value.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\ScriptBlockLogging\EnableScriptBlockLogging" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\ScriptBlockLogging\EnableScriptBlockLogging"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\ScriptBlockLogging\EnableScriptBlockLogging"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/ADM Remediation

rules.name: PowerShell script block logging must be enabled on Windows 2012/2012 R2 - 2
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000135
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Enabling PowerShell script block logging will record detailed information from the processing of PowerShell commands and scripts. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.
PowerShell 5.x supports script block logging. PowerShell 4.0 with the addition of patch KB3000850 on Windows 2012 R2 or KB3119938 on Windows 2012 adds support for script block logging.
Note: This rule is divided into 2 parts. This part checks powershell version with patch requirement on windows 2012 and 2012 R2.
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   ??TARGET.OS_VERSION?? equals "2012 R2"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\PowerShell\3\PowerShellEngine\PowerShellVersion"."String Value (Windows)" matches "5.*"  OR
   (  "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\PowerShell\3\PowerShellEngine\PowerShellVersion"."String Value (Windows)" equals "4.0"  AND
      "Windows Hotfix:KB3000850" exists
   )
end  AND
if
   ??TARGET.OS_VERSION?? equals "2012"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\PowerShell\3\PowerShellEngine\PowerShellVersion"."String Value (Windows)" matches "5.*"  OR
   (  "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\PowerShell\3\PowerShellEngine\PowerShellVersion"."String Value (Windows)" equals "4.0"  AND
      "Windows Hotfix:KB3119938" exists
   )
end

rules.name: Windows PowerShell 2.0 must not be installed on Windows 2012/2012 R2.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000381
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
Vulnerability Discussion:  Windows PowerShell versions 4.0 (with a patch) and 5.x add advanced logging features that can provide additional detail when malware has been run on a system. Ensuring Windows PowerShell 2.0 is not installed as well mitigates against a downgrade attack that evades the advanced logging features of later Windows PowerShell versions.

IAControls:  ECSC-1
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Extended Object Entry:installed_features//SRR_Result/Status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" does not equal "Not a finding"
then
   foreach "Extended Object Entry:installed_features//SRR_Result/Findings/Finding*"
      @"Value1 as String (All OS)"@ does not match "Feature: PowerShell-v2 .*"  OR
      @"Value1 as String (All OS)"@ does not match "Feature: PowerShell-V2 .*"
   end
end

rules.name: The Active Directory SYSVOL directory must have the proper access control permissions.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002235
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Improper access permissions for directory data files could allow unauthorized users to read, modify, or delete directory data.
The SYSVOL directory contains public files (to the domain) such as policies and logon scripts.  Data in shared subdirectories are replicated to all domain controllers in a domain.
IAControls: ECCD-1, ECCD-2

Note: Remediation is not provided.

The below given permission need to check manually. If we check permission for subfolder and files, it scan all subfolder and files of that directory for permission. which is time consuming.

Type - Allow
Principal - CREATOR OWNER
Access - Full control
Inherited from - None
Applies to - Subfolders and files only

Type - Allow
Principal - Administrators
Access - Full control
Inherited from - None
Applies to - Subfolders and files only
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Directory:??TARGET.WINDIR??/SYSVOL/sysvol" exists
then
   "Directory:??TARGET.WINDIR??/SYSVOL/sysvol"."Inherit Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" equals false  AND
   "Directory:??TARGET.WINDIR??/SYSVOL/sysvol"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\SYSTEM Allow []"  AND
   "Directory:??TARGET.WINDIR??/SYSVOL/sysvol"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\ADMINISTRATORS Allow [-Delete Subfolders and Files]"  AND
   "Directory:??TARGET.WINDIR??/SYSVOL/sysvol"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\AUTHENTICATED USERS Allow [-Create Files/Write Data, -Create Folders/Append Data, -Write Attributes, -Write Extended Attributes, -Delete Subfolders and Files, -Delete, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"  AND

rules.name: Review Required: The Active Directory Domain Controllers Organizational Unit (OU) object must have the proper access control permissions.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002235			  
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: When Active Directory (AD) objects do not have appropriate access control permissions, it may be possible for malicious users to create, read, update, or delete the objects and degrade or destroy the integrity of the data.  When the directory service is used for identification, authentication, or authorization functions, a compromise of the database objects could lead to a compromise of all systems that rely on the directory service.
The Domain Controllers OU object requires special attention as the Domain Controllers are central to the configuration and management of the domain.  Inappropriate access permissions defined for the Domain Controllers OU could allow an intruder or unauthorized personnel to make changes which could lead to the compromise of the domain.
IAControls: ECCD-1, ECCD-2, ECLP-1
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Review Required: Domain created Active Directory Organizational Unit (OU) objects must have proper access control permissions.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002235			  
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: When directory service database objects do not have appropriate access control permissions, it may be possible for malicious users to create, read, update, or delete the objects and degrade or destroy the integrity of the data.  When the directory service is used for identification, authentication, or authorization functions, a compromise of the database objects could lead to a compromise of all systems that rely on the directory service.
For Active Directory (AD), the Organizational Unit (OU) objects require special attention.  In a distributed administration model (i.e., help desk), OU objects are more likely to have access permissions changed from the secure defaults.  If inappropriate access permissions are defined for OU objects, it could allow an intruder to add or delete users in the OU.  This could result in unauthorized access to data or a Denial of Service to authorized users.
SeverityOverrideGuidance: If any OU with improper permissions includes identification or authentication data (e.g., accounts, passwords, or password hash data) used by systems to determine access control, the severity is Category I (e.g., OUs that include user accounts, including service/application accounts).
If the OU with improper permissions does not include identification and authentication data used by systems to determine access control, the severity is Category II (e.g., Workstation, Printer OUs).
IAControls: ECCD-1, ECCD-2, ECLP-1
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage failures.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Ident:CCI-000172			  
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised.  Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Removable Storage auditing under Object Access records events related to access attempts on file system objects on removable storage devices.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Object Access\Audit Removable Storage"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [2, 3]  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Object Access\Audit Removable Storage"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [2, 3]

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/Auditpol Remediation

rules.name: Permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by nonprivileged accounts.
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000162
Ident: CCI-000163
Ident: CCI-000164

Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. end

rules.name: Review Required: Active Directory Group Policy objects must be configured with proper audit settings.
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000172
Ident: CCI-002234	  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: When inappropriate audit settings are configured for directory service database objects, it may be possible for a user or process to update the data without generating any tracking data.  The impact of missing audit data is related to the type of object.  A failure to capture audit data for objects used by identification, authentication, or authorization functions could degrade or eliminate the ability to track changes to access policy for systems or data. 
For Active Directory (AD), there are a number of critical object types in the domain naming context of the AD database for which auditing is essential.  This includes Group Policy objects.  Because changes to these objects can significantly impact access controls or the availability of systems, the absence of auditing data makes it impossible to identify the source of changes that impact the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data and systems throughout an AD domain.  The lack of proper auditing can result in insufficient forensic evidence needed to investigate an incident and prosecute the intruder.
IAControls: ECAR-1, ECAR-2, ECAR-3
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Event Viewer must be protected from unauthorized modification and deletion.
rules.notes:
Vulnerability Discussion:  Protecting audit information also includes identifying and protecting the tools used to view and manipulate log data. Therefore, protecting audit tools is necessary to prevent unauthorized operation on audit information.
Operating systems providing tools to interface with audit information will leverage user permissions and roles identifying the user accessing the tools and the corresponding rights the user enjoys in order to make access decisions regarding the modification or deletion of audit tools.

Fix Text: Ensure only TrustedInstaller has permissions to change or modify Event Viewer ("%SystemRoot%\SYSTEM32Eventvwr.exe).
The default permissions below satisfy this requirement.
TrustedInstaller - Full Control
Administrators, SYSTEM, Users, ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES - Read & Execute
rules.ruleExpression:
"File:??TARGET.SYSTEMROOT??/System32/eventvwr.exe" exists  AND
"File:??TARGET.SYSTEMROOT??/System32/eventvwr.exe"."Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\TRUSTEDINSTALLER Allow []"  AND
"File:??TARGET.SYSTEMROOT??/System32/eventvwr.exe"."Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\ADMINISTRATORS Allow [-Create Files/Write Data, -Create Folders/Append Data, -Write Attributes, -Write Extended Attributes, -Delete Subfolders and Files, -Delete, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"  AND
"File:??TARGET.SYSTEMROOT??/System32/eventvwr.exe"."Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\SYSTEM Allow [-Create Files/Write Data, -Create Folders/Append Data, -Write Attributes, -Write Extended Attributes, -Delete Subfolders and Files, -Delete, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"  AND
"File:??TARGET.SYSTEMROOT??/System32/eventvwr.exe"."Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\USERS Allow [-Create Files/Write Data, -Create Folders/Append Data, -Write Attributes, -Write Extended Attributes, -Delete Subfolders and Files, -Delete, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"  AND
"File:??TARGET.SYSTEMROOT??/System32/eventvwr.exe"."Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES Allow [-Create Files/Write Data, -Create Folders/Append Data, -Write Attributes, -Write Extended Attributes, -Delete Subfolders and Files, -Delete, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"

rules.name: Windows Server 2012/2012 R2 must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Account Lockout successes.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000172,CCI-001404
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
Vulnerability Discussion:  Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Account Lockout events can be used to identify potentially malicious logon attempts.

IAControls:  ECSC-1
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Logon/Logoff\Audit Account Lockout"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Logon/Logoff\Audit Account Lockout"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Logon/Logoff\Audit Account Lockout"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [1, 3]  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Logon/Logoff\Audit Account Lockout"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [1, 3]

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/Auditpol Remediation

ident: CCE-24070-5

rules.name: Optional component installation and component repair must be prevented from using Windows Update.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Uncontrolled system updates can introduce issues to a system.  Obtaining update components from an outside source may also potentially provide sensitive information outside of the enterprise.  Optional component installation or repair must be obtained from an internal source.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23727-1
ident: CCI-001812
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Servicing\UseWindowsUpdate" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Servicing\UseWindowsUpdate"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Servicing\UseWindowsUpdate"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 2

rules.name: Device driver updates must only search managed servers, not Windows Update.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Uncontrolled system updates can introduce issues to a system.  Obtaining update components from an outside source may also potentially provide sensitive information outside of the enterprise.  Device driver updates must be obtained from an internal source.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25002-7
ident: CCI-001812
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DriverSearching\DriverServerSelection" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DriverSearching\DriverServerSelection"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DriverSearching\DriverServerSelection"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must be enabled and configured to only Good and Unknown.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Compromised boot drivers can introduce malware prior to some protection mechanisms that load after initialization.  The Early Launch Antimalware driver can limit allowed drivers based on classifications determined by the malware protection application.  At a minimum, drivers determined to be bad must not be allowed.
IAControls: ECVP-1
ident: CCE-25320-3
ident: CCI-000366
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Policies\EarlyLaunch\DriverLoadPolicy" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Policies\EarlyLaunch\DriverLoadPolicy"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Policies\EarlyLaunch\DriverLoadPolicy"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Access to the Windows Store must be turned off.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Uncontrolled installation of applications can introduce various issues, including system instability, and allow access to sensitive information.  Installation of applications must be controlled by the enterprise.  Turning off access to the Windows Store will limit access to publicly available applications.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCI-000366
Note: If Windows Store is not installed ,Mark rule as exception as Windows Store is not installed by default . Remediation is not provided.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer\NoUseStoreOpenWith" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer\NoUseStoreOpenWith"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer\NoUseStoreOpenWith"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Copying of user input methods to the system account for sign-in must be prevented.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing different input methods for sign-in could open different avenues of attack.  User input methods must be restricted to those enabled for the system account at sign-in.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24401-2
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Control Panel\International\BlockUserInputMethodsForSignIn" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Control Panel\International\BlockUserInputMethodsForSignIn"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Control Panel\International\BlockUserInputMethodsForSignIn"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Local users on domain-joined computers must not be enumerated.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The username is one part of logon credentials that could be used to gain access to a system.  Preventing the enumeration of users limits this information to authorized personnel.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23305-6
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\EnumerateLocalUsers" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\EnumerateLocalUsers"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\EnumerateLocalUsers"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: App notifications on the lock screen must be turned off.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: App notifications that are displayed on the lock screen could display sensitive information to unauthorized personnel.  Turning off this feature will limit access to the information to a logged on user.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24092-9
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\DisableLockScreenAppNotifications" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\DisableLockScreenAppNotifications"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\DisableLockScreenAppNotifications"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: The detection of compatibility issues for applications and drivers must be turned off.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24560-5
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\AppCompat\DisablePcaUI" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\AppCompat\DisablePcaUI"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\AppCompat\DisablePcaUI"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: Trusted app installation must be enabled to allow for signed enterprise line of business apps.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Enabling trusted app installation allows for enterprise line of business Windows 8 type apps.   A trusted app package is one that is signed with a certificate chain that can be successfully validated in the enterprise.  Configuring this ensures enterprise line of business apps are accessible.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23960-8
ident: CCI-000366
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Appx\AllowAllTrustedApps" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Appx\AllowAllTrustedApps"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Appx\AllowAllTrustedApps"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: The use of biometrics must be disabled.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing biometrics may bypass required authentication methods.  Biometrics may only be used as an additional authentication factor where an enhanced strength of identity credential is necessary or desirable.  Additional factors must be met per DoD policy.
IAControls: IAIA-1
ident: CCE-24801-3
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Biometrics\Enabled" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Biometrics\Enabled"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Biometrics\Enabled"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: The password reveal button must not be displayed.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Visible passwords may be seen by nearby persons, compromising them.  The password reveal button can be used to display an entered password and must not be allowed.
IAControls: IAIA-1
ident: CCE-23228-0
ident: CCI-000206
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\CredUI\DisablePasswordReveal" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\CredUI\DisablePasswordReveal"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\CredUI\DisablePasswordReveal"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: Windows SmartScreen must be enabled on Windows 2012/2012 R2.
rules.notes:
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Windows SmartScreen helps protect systems from programs downloaded from the Internet that may be malicious. Warning a user before running downloaded unknown software, at minimum, will help prevent potentially malicious programs from executing.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCI-000185, CCI-002470
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\EnableSmartScreen" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\EnableSmartScreen"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\EnableSmartScreen"."Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [1, 2]

rules.name: The location feature must be turned off.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The location service on systems may allow sensitive data to be used by applications on the system.  This should be turned off unless explicitly allowed for approved systems/applications.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-25343-5
ident: CCI-000381
Note: If location services are approved for the system by the organization set ARE_LOCATION_SERVICES_APPROVED to true. Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   ??ARE_LOCATION_SERVICES_APPROVED?? equals false
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\LocationAndSensors\DisableLocation" exists  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\LocationAndSensors\DisableLocation"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\LocationAndSensors\DisableLocation"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1
end

rules.name: Basic authentication for RSS feeds over HTTP must be turned off.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Basic authentication uses plain text passwords that could be used to compromise a system.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23213-2
ident: CCI-000381
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Feeds\AllowBasicAuthInClear" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Feeds\AllowBasicAuthInClear"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Feeds\AllowBasicAuthInClear"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: Automatic download of updates from the Windows Store must be turned off.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366

Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Uncontrolled system updates can introduce issues to a system.  Obtaining update components from an outside source may also potentially allow sensitive information outside of the enterprise.  Application updates must be obtained from an internal source.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note: If Windows Store is not installed ,Mark rule as exception as Windows Store is not installed by default . Remediation is not provided.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   ??TARGET.OS_RELEASE?? equals "6.3"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsStore\AutoDownload" exists  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsStore\AutoDownload"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsStore\AutoDownload"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 2
else
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsStore\WindowsUpdate\AutoDownload" exists  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsStore\WindowsUpdate\AutoDownload"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsStore\WindowsUpdate\AutoDownload"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 2
end

rules.name: The Windows Store application must be turned off.
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000366			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Uncontrolled installation of applications can introduce various issues, including system instability, and provide access to sensitive information.  Installation of applications must be controlled by the enterprise.  Turning off access to the Windows Store will limit access to publicly available applications.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note: If Windows Store is not installed ,Mark rule as exception as Windows Store is not installed by default . Remediation is not provided.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsStore\RemoveWindowsStore" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsStore\RemoveWindowsStore"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsStore\RemoveWindowsStore"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Basic authentication.
rules.notes:
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Basic authentication uses plain text passwords that could be used to compromise a system.
IAControls: IAIA-1
ident: CCE-24431-9
ident: CCI-000877
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client\AllowBasic" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client\AllowBasic"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client\AllowBasic"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not allow unencrypted traffic.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Unencrypted remote access to a system can allow sensitive information to be compromised.  Windows remote management connections must be encrypted to prevent this.
IAControls: ECCT-1
ident: CCE-23728-9
ident: CCI-003123
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client\AllowUnencryptedTraffic" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client\AllowUnencryptedTraffic"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client\AllowUnencryptedTraffic"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Digest authentication.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Digest authentication is not as strong as other options and may be subject to man-in-the-middle attacks.
IAControls: IAIA-1
ident: CCE-25263-5
ident: CCI-000877
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client\AllowDigest" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client\AllowDigest"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client\AllowDigest"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not use Basic authentication.
rules.notes:
Severity: high
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Basic authentication uses plain text passwords that could be used to compromise a system.  
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-23637-2
ident: CCI-000877
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Service\AllowBasic" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Service\AllowBasic"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Service\AllowBasic"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not allow unencrypted traffic.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Unencrypted remote access to a system can allow sensitive information to be compromised.  Windows remote management connections must be encrypted to prevent this.
IAControls: ECCT-1
ident: CCE-25102-5
ident: CCI-003123
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Service\AllowUnencryptedTraffic" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Service\AllowUnencryptedTraffic"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Service\AllowUnencryptedTraffic"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0

rules.name: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not store RunAs credentials.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0

IAControls: ECLP-1
ident: CCE-23262-9
ident: CCI-002038
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Service\DisableRunAs" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Service\DisableRunAs"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Service\DisableRunAs"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1

rules.name: The display of slide shows on the lock screen must be disabled.  (Windows 2012 R2)
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000381
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Slide shows that are displayed on the lock screen could display sensitive information to unauthorized personnel.  Turning off this feature will limit access to the information to a logged on user.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   ??TARGET.OS_RELEASE?? equals "6.3"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Personalization\NoLockScreenSlideshow" exists  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Personalization\NoLockScreenSlideshow"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Personalization\NoLockScreenSlideshow"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1
end

rules.name: Windows 2012 R2 must include command line data in process creation events
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000135
everity: medium
Weight:	10.0
Vulnerability Discussion:  Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Enabling "Include command line data for process creation events" will record the command line information with the process creation events in the log. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.

IAControls:  ECSC-1
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   ??TARGET.OS_RELEASE?? equals "6.3"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\Audit\ProcessCreationIncludeCmdLine_Enabled" exists  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\Audit\ProcessCreationIncludeCmdLine_Enabled"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\Audit\ProcessCreationIncludeCmdLine_Enabled"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1
end

rules.name: The network selection user interface (UI) must not be displayed on the logon screen.   (Windows 2012 R2)
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000381			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Enabling interaction with the network selection UI allows users to change connections to available networks without signing into Windows.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   ??TARGET.OS_RELEASE?? equals "6.3"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\DontDisplayNetworkSelectionUI" exists  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\DontDisplayNetworkSelectionUI"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System\DontDisplayNetworkSelectionUI"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1
end

rules.name: The setting to allow Microsoft accounts to be optional for modern style apps must be enabled.   (Windows 2012 R2)
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366			  
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Control of credentials and the system must be maintained within the enterprise.  Enabling this setting allows enterprise credentials to be used with modern style apps that support this, instead of Microsoft accounts.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   ??TARGET.OS_RELEASE?? equals "6.3"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\MSAOptional" exists  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\MSAOptional"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\MSAOptional"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1
end

rules.name: Automatically signing in the last interactive user after a system-initiated restart must be disabled.  (Windows 2012 R2)
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002038			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Windows 2012 R2 can be configured to automatically sign the user back in after a Windows Update restart.  Some protections are in place to help ensure this is done in a secure fashion; however, disabling this will prevent the caching of credentials for this purpose and also ensure the user is aware of the restart.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note: Remediation is not available.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   ??TARGET.OS_RELEASE?? equals "6.3"
then
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\DisableAutomaticRestartSignOn" exists  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\DisableAutomaticRestartSignOn"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
   "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\DisableAutomaticRestartSignOn"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1
end

rules.name: WDigest Authentication must be disabled.
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000381
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion:When the WDigest Authentication protocol is enabled, plain text passwords are stored in the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) exposing them to theft. This setting will prevent WDigest from storing credentials in memory.
rules.ruleExpression:
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest\UseLogonCredential" exists  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest\UseLogonCredential"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 0  AND
"Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest\UseLogonCredential"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/ADM Remediation

rules.name: Review Required: A host-based firewall must be installed and enabled on the system.
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000366			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: A firewall provides a line of defense against attack, allowing or blocking inbound and outbound connections based on a set of rules.
IAControls: ECSC-1
Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Review Required: User-level information must be backed up in accordance with local recovery time and recovery point objectives.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000366			  
Severity: low
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Operating system backup is a critical step in maintaining data assurance and availability. User-level information is data generated by information system and/or application users. Backups shall be consistent with organizational recovery time and recovery point objectives.

Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Review Required: The operating system must employ automated mechanisms to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-001233			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Without the use of automated mechanisms to scan for security flaws on a continuous and/or periodic basis, the operating system or other system components may remain vulnerable to the exploits presented by undetected software flaws. The operating system may have an integrated solution incorporating continuous scanning using HBSS and periodic scanning using other tools..

Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Review Required: The system must support automated patch management tools to facilitate flaw remediation.
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000366			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: The organization (including any contractor to the organization) must promptly install security-relevant software updates (e.g., patches, service packs, hot fixes).  Flaws discovered during security assessments, continuous monitoring, incident response activities, or information system error handling must also be addressed.

Note : Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided

rules.name: Review Required: The system must query the certification authority to determine whether a public key certificate has been revoked before accepting the certificate for authentication purposes.

Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Failure to verify a certificate's revocation status can result in the system accepting a revoked, and therefore unauthorized, certificate.  This could result in the installation of unauthorized software or a connection for rogue networks, depending on the use for which the certificate is intended.   Querying for certificate revocation mitigates the risk that the system will accept an unauthorized certificate.

rules.name: Review Required: Windows 2012 / 2012 R2 must automatically remove or disable temporary user accounts after 72 hours.
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-000016	  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion:  If temporary user accounts remain active when no longer needed or for an excessive period, these accounts may be used to gain unauthorized access. To mitigate this risk, automated termination of all temporary accounts must be set upon account creation.
Note: Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

rules.name: Review Required: The operating system must be configured such that emergency administrator accounts are never automatically removed or disabled.
rules.notes:
Ident: CCI-001682
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Emergency administrator accounts are privileged accounts which are established in response to crisis situations where the need for rapid account activation is required. Therefore, emergency account activation may bypass normal account authorization processes. If these accounts are automatically disabled, system maintenance during emergencies may not be possible, thus adversely affecting system availability.

Emergency administrator accounts are different from infrequently used accounts (i.e., local logon accounts used by system administrators when network or normal logon/access is not available). Infrequently used accounts also remain available and are not subject to automatic termination dates. However, an emergency administrator account is normally a different account which is created for use by vendors or system maintainers.

To address access requirements, many operating systems can be integrated with enterprise-level authentication/access mechanisms that meet or exceed access control policy requirements.
Note: Manual compliance check, Remediation is not provided
rules.ruleExpression: ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false

ruleGroups.name: WINRG-000001 Active Setup_Installed Components Registry Permissions

rules.name: Standard user accounts must only have Read permissions to the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key.
rules.notes:
Severity: high
Ident:CCI-002235			 
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Permissions on the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key must only allow privileged accounts to add or change registry values.  If standard user accounts have this capability, there is a potential for programs to run with elevated privileges when a privileged user logs on to the system. 

Note: Remediation is not provided.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Registry Key:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components" exists
then
   "Registry Key:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components"."Permission ACL (DACL) (Windows)" has only ACEs matching masks ["*\ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES Allow [-Set Value, -Create Subkey, -Create Link, -Delete, -Write DAC, -Write Owner]", "*\ADMINISTRATORS * []", "*\SYSTEM * []", "*\CREATOR OWNER Allow []"]
end  AND
if
   ??TARGET.OS_PLATFORM?? equals "x86_64"
then
   if
      "Registry Key:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components" exists
   then
      "Registry Key:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components"."Permission ACL (DACL) (Windows)" has only ACEs matching masks ["*\ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES Allow [-Set Value, -Create Subkey, -Create Link, -Delete, -Write DAC, -Write Owner]", "*\ADMINISTRATORS * []", "*\SYSTEM * []", "*\CREATOR OWNER Allow []"]
   end
end

rules.name: The machine inactivity limit must be set to 15 minutes, locking the system with the screensaver.
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Unattended systems are susceptible to unauthorized use and should be locked when unattended.  The screen saver should be set at a maximum of 15 minutes and be password protected.  This protects critical and sensitive data from exposure to unauthorized personnel with physical access to the computer.
IAControls: PESL-1
ident: CCE-23043-3
ident: CCI-000057
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" between [1 AND 900]  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" between [1 AND 900]

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: Users must be required to enter a password to access private keys stored on the computer.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000186
Severity: CAT II 
Vulnerability Discussion:  If the private key is discovered, an attacker can use the key to authenticate as an authorized user and gain access to the network infrastructure.

The cornerstone of the PKI is the private key used to encrypt or digitally sign information.

If the private key is stolen, this will lead to the compromise of the authentication and non-repudiation gained through PKI because the attacker can use the private key to digitally sign documents and pretend to be the authorized user.

Both the holders of a digital certificate and the issuing authority must protect the computers, storage devices, or whatever they use to keep the private keys.

Fix text: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "System cryptography: Force strong key protection for user keys stored on the computer" to "User must enter a password each time they use a key".
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\System cryptography: Force strong key protection for user keys stored on the computer"."Effective setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\System cryptography: Force strong key protection for user keys stored on the computer"."Local setting as String Value (Windows)" does not equal null  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\System cryptography: Force strong key protection for user keys stored on the computer"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 2  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\System cryptography: Force strong key protection for user keys stored on the computer"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" equals 2

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/GPO Remediation

rules.name: The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Central Access Policy Staging successes.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-000172			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised.  Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Central Access Policy Staging auditing under Object Access is used to enable the recording of events related to differences in permissions between central access policies and proposed policies.
IAControls: ECAR-2, ECAR-3
rules.ruleExpression:
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Object Access\Audit Central Policy Staging"."Effective setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [1, 3]  AND
"Security Setting:Security Settings\Advanced Audit Policy Configuration\System Audit Policies - Local Group Policy\Object Access\Audit Central Policy Staging"."Local setting as Integer Value (Windows)" is one of [1, 3]

remediation.packagePath: /DISA Compliance Content/Remediation Packages/DISA - Windows Server 2012 DC/Auditpol Remediation

Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.
Central Access Policy Staging auditing under Object Access is used to enable the recording of events related to differences in permissions between central access policies and proposed policies.
IAControls: ECAR-2, ECAR-3

.

rules.name: Only the default client printer must be redirected to the Remote Desktop Session Host.  (Remote Desktop Services Role).
rules.notes:
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Allowing the redirection of only the default client printer to a Remote Desktop session helps reduce possible exposure of sensitive data.
IAControls: ECSC-1
ident: CCE-24504-3
ident: CCI-000366
Note : Remediation is not provided . Compliance will check only if Remote desktop role is installed.
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Extended Object Entry:List all installed services and roles//SRR_Result/Status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals "Open"
then
   foreach "Extended Object Entry:List all installed services and roles//SRR_Result/Findings/*"
      if
         @"Value1 as String (All OS)"@ contains "Remote-Desktop-Services"
      then
         "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\RedirectOnlyDefaultClientPrinter" exists  AND
         "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\RedirectOnlyDefaultClientPrinter"."Data Type (Windows)" equals "REG_DWORD"  AND
         "Registry Value:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\RedirectOnlyDefaultClientPrinter"."Integer Value (Windows)" equals 1
      end
   end
else
   if
      "Extended Object Entry:List all installed services and roles//SRR_Result/Status"."Value1 as String (All OS)" equals "Not Reviewed"
   then
      ??TARGET.NOT_REVIEWED?? equals false
   end
end

rules.name: Permissions for system drive root directory (usually C:) must conform to minimum requirements.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002165			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Changing the system's file and directory permissions allows the possibility of unauthorized and anonymous modification to the operating system and installed applications.
The default permissions are adequate when the Security Option "Network access: Let everyone permissions apply to anonymous users" is set to "Disabled" (V-3377).  
IAControls: ECCD-1, ECCD-2

Note: Remediation is not provided.

The below given permission need to check manually. If we check permission for subfolder and files, it scan all subfolder and files of that directory for permission. which is time consuming.

Users - Create files / write data - Subfolders only
CREATOR OWNER - Full Control - Subfolders and files only
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??" exists
then
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??"."Inherit Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" equals false  AND
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\SYSTEM Allow []"  AND
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\ADMINISTRATORS Allow []"  AND
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\USERS Allow [-Write Attributes, -Write Extended Attributes, -Delete Subfolders and Files, -Delete, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"
end

rules.name: Permissions for program file directories must conform to minimum requirements.
rules.notes:
Ident:CCI-002165			  
Severity: medium
Weight:	10.0
VulnDiscussion: Changing the system's file and directory permissions allows the possibility of unauthorized and anonymous modification to the operating system and installed applications.
The default permissions are adequate when the Security Option "Network access: Let everyone permissions apply to anonymous users" is set to "Disabled" (V-3377).  
IAControls: ECCD-1, ECCD-2

Note: Remediation is not provided.

The below given permission need to check manually. If we check permission for subfolder and files, it scan all subfolder and files of that directory for permission. which is time consuming.

SYSTEM - Full control - Subfolders and files only
Administrators - Full control - Subfolders and files only
CREATOR OWNER - Full control - Subfolders and files only
rules.ruleExpression:
if
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files" exists
then
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files"."Inherit Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" equals false  AND
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\TRUSTEDINSTALLER Allow []"  AND
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\SYSTEM Allow [-Delete Subfolders and Files, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"  AND
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\ADMINISTRATORS Allow [-Delete Subfolders and Files, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"  AND
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\USERS Allow [-Create Files/Write Data, -Create Folders/Append Data, -Write Attributes, -Write Extended Attributes, -Delete Subfolders and Files, -Delete, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"  AND
   "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES Allow [-Create Files/Write Data, -Create Folders/Append Data, -Write Attributes, -Write Extended Attributes, -Delete Subfolders and Files, -Delete, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"  AND
   if
      "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files (x86)" exists
   then
      "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files (x86)"."Inherit Permission ACL (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" equals false  AND
      "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files (x86)"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\TRUSTEDINSTALLER Allow []"  AND
      "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files (x86)"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\SYSTEM Allow [-Delete Subfolders and Files, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"  AND
      "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files (x86)"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\ADMINISTRATORS Allow [-Delete Subfolders and Files, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"  AND
      "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files (x86)"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\USERS Allow [-Create Files/Write Data, -Create Folders/Append Data, -Write Attributes, -Write Extended Attributes, -Delete Subfolders and Files, -Delete, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"  AND
      "Directory:??TARGET.SYSTEMDRIVE??/Program Files (x86)"."Permission ACL  (Windows NTFS) (Windows)" has ACE matching mask "*\ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES Allow [-Create Files/Write Data, -Create Folders/Append Data, -Write Attributes, -Write Extended Attributes, -Delete Subfolders and Files, -Delete, -Change Permissions, -Take Ownership]"
   end
end
